She’s been in this line of work for two years and she does well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  Her dream is to open a store where she can sell her products and become a supplier of the lithographs.

On this occasion Soledad wants the loan to increase capital buying more lithographs.

Soledad is a responsible person who is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Ana Jarvis III” communal bank in the city of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to buy more laminated lithographs.

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Saroeun is married to Mrs. Sao Vanny and both of them are farmers who own a small piece of land where they grow rice, and they are chicken breeders. Although they try to work hard, they can earn little income. 

To improve this condition, Saroeun is asking for a loan to buy some piglets for breeding to start a new business. With the rest of the loan he is going to buy some materials to make rice wine, which is also a new business for him. He is the father of three children, one of whom is a laborer, another one does housework, and the last is too young to work or study.

loans.use: to buy some piglets

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina nació en la provincia de Chumbivilca del departamento del Cusco y tiene 51 años de edad. Actualmente, Marina vive en la ciudad imperial de los Incas (Cusco, Perú) junto con sus tres hijos,  ella es una madre responsable que saca adelante a su familia y  su actividad económica principal es vender comida, ella nos cuenta que tiene un puesto de venta de forma ambulatoria en el paradero final de carros de transporte urbano “La Liebre”. Ya son varios años que trabaja en este negocio y va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 
 
Marina en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar más insumos como por ejemplo arroz, fideos, carne, verduras y otras cosas más que se necesita.
 
Marina es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Ana Jarvis III” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Marina was born in the Chumbivilca province in the department of Cusco and is 51 years old. Currently, she lives in an Incan city (in Cusco, Peru) with her three sons.  She is a responsible mother who is focused on moving forward with her family. Her main economic activity is selling food. She tells us that she sells these items at the last stop of the "La Liebre" urban transportation line (either taxis, minibuses, rickshaws or buses).

She has worked in this business for many years and it's going very well thanks to the dedication she puts into her work. 

Marina, in this opportunity, needs this loan in order to expand her business's capital and she wishes to buy more products such as rice, noodles, meat, vegetable and other things that she needs.

Marina is a very responsible person who belongs to the communal bank "Ana Jarvis III" of the Asociación Arariwa in Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as rice, noodles, meat, vegetables and other items that she needs.

loans.name: Chork's Group

texts.en:
The five people who make up this group loan have selected Chork, who is a 29-year-old married woman, to be the group leader. The members of this group will use their portions of the loan in various ways to improve their families' standard of living. 

Chork and her husband, Soeun, are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to grow taro for a living. Chork also sells lotus root. 

Currently, Chork would like to ask for a loan to dig a well for using. She would use the rest of the loan to pay for hiring laborers to cultivate her taros. 

This couple has two children. One attends a local school while the younger one is only three years old.

loans.use: to dig a well

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina nació en la provincia de Cusco del departamento del Cusco y tiene 35 años de edad. Actualmente, Justina vive en la ciudad imperial de los Incas (Cusco, Perú) junto con sus dos hijos,  ella es una madre responsable que saca adelante a su familia y  su actividad económica principal es trabajar en el terminal terrestre de la ciudad del Cuso en el área de limpieza. Ya son varios años que trabaja en este negocio y va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 
 
Justina en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal específicamente para matricula de su hija Sharmely que está postulando a la Universidad de Nacional San Antonio Abad de la ciudad del Cusco a la carrera profesional de enfermería. 
 
Justina es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Ana Jarvis III” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Justina was born in Cusco Province and Department and is 35 years old.  Justina currently lives in the Imperial City of the Incas (Cusco, Perú) with her two children.  She is a responsible mother who moves her family forward.  Her main economic activity is working as a Cleaning Lady at Cusco’s bus terminal.  She’s been in this line of work for several years and does well thanks to the effort she puts into it.

On this occasion Justina needs a loan for personal use, specifically to pay her daughter Sharmely’s tuition at Cusco’s San Antonio Abad National University.  She’s studying Nursing.

Justina is a responsible person who is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Ana Jarvis III” communal bank in the city of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
Pamela nació en la provincia de Cusco del departamento del Cusco y tiene 29 años de edad. Actualmente, Pamela vive en la misma ciudad donde nació ósea en la ciudad imperial de los Incas (Cusco, Perú), ella es una madre responsable que saca adelante a su familia y su actividad económica principal es la venta de ceviche de forma ambulatoria. Ya son cuatro años que trabaja en este negocio y va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 
 
Pamela en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal específicamente para los utiles escolares de sus hijos. Su sueño de Pamela es abrir un restaurante donde pueda vende ceviche pero ella muy emocionada nos cuenta que está buscando el local para poder vender sus ricos platos de comida.    
 
Pamela es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Ana Jarvis III” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Pamela was born in Cusco Province and Department and is 29 years old.  Today, Pamela still lives in the city of her birth, namely, the Imperial City of the Incas (Cusco, Perú).  She is a responsible mother who moves her family forward.  Her main economic activity is selling ceviche (marinated seafood cocktail) in an itinerant way.  She has been in this line of work for four years now and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into it.

On this occasion Pamela needs a loan for personal use, specifically to pay for her children’s school supplies.  Pamela’s dream is to open a restaurant where she can sell her ceviche and she’s very excited about this; she relates that she’s looking for a locale in which to sell her delicious dishes.

Pamela is a responsible person who is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Ana Jarvis III” communal bank in the city of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to buy her children's school supplies.

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
Yovana nació en la provincia de Cusco del departamento del Cusco y tiene 32 años de edad. Actualmente, Yovana vive en la misma ciudad donde nació ósea en la ciudad imperial de los Incas (Cusco, Perú), ella es una madre responsable que saca adelante a su familia y su actividad económica principal es la venta de productos de belleza. Ya son dos años que trabaja en este negocio y va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 
 
Yovana en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos de belleza. Su sueño de Yovana es tener su propio negocio y tener su propia casa. 

Yovana es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Ana Jarvis III” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Yovana was born in the Cusco province and department and is 32 years old. Currently, Yovana lives in the same city where she was born, that is in the imperial city of the Incas (Cusco, Perú). She is a responsible mother who is working to get her family ahead and her main line of business is selling beauty products. She has already been working in this business for two years and it is going very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. 
 
Yovana at this time requires the loan to purchase more beauty products. Yovana's dream is to have her own business and her own home. 

Yovana is a responsible person who belongs to the “Ana Jarvis III” communal bank of the "Asociación Arariwa" in the city of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Chroep

texts.en:
Chroep is the mother of four children who are studying in the local public school, and they also help her with her business. She was born in 1972. She and her husband, Kan, are secondhand clothes sellers who can earn some profit in that way to support their family.

They are also pig breeders. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. So to improve her business, Chroep is asking for a loan to buy six more piglets and pig food.

loans.use: to buy six more piglets and pig food

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of five members who have selected Srey as the group leader. All the members will use their portion of the loan to improve their families' living standards.

Srey, a farmer born in 1981, owns a one-hectare plot of land upon which she grows rice, some allotted for sale with the rest being used to feed her family. Her husband. Daren, a taxi driver, is able to earn some money to help support the family. They have a one-year-old son.

Because the taxi's car wheel requires replacement, Srey is requesting a loan to buy a new wheel, with the rest of the money being used to purchase some piglets to start a breeding business.

loans.use: to buy a new wheel

loans.name: Chhith

texts.en:
Mrs.Chhith was born in 1983 and is married to Mr. Phorn, who was born in 1971. They have four children, two of whom are attending in the local public school. The other two are too young to study or work. 

Her husband is a construction worker and also a fisherman who is able to earn a small income to support his family. 

Mrs. Chhith is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she grows rice. She also earns her living by breeding pigs. In order to support these  businesses, she would like to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. The rest of the loan she would use to support her crop.  

Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: to buy more piglets for breeding and to support her farming crop

loans.name: Sochenda's Group

texts.en:
The six members who make up this group loan will use their portions of the loan for different purposes that can improve their families' standard of living. They have selected Mrs. Sochenda to become the group leader. 

Mrs. Sochenda was born in 1959. She is a widow with two children, one of whom is a seamstress in garment factory. The other is studying in local public school. 

She is a chicken breeder and a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land where she can grow rice. She sells a part of the rice and mills another part and then sells it. The rest of the rice she uses to support her family. 

Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand. So to achieve this purpose, Mrs. Sochenda is seeking a loan to buy more rice for milling and selling and also to buy more chickens.

loans.use: to buy more rice for milling and to buy more chickens

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Mrs. Meas was born in 1964 and has nine children. Three of them are laborers, five are attending in the public local schoO., and the youngest one is 5 years old.
 
Mrs. Meas and her husband are farmers who own a plot of land where they grow rice and different vegetables to make their living. 

Now they want to grow rice in the dry season, but they do not have enough money to support that. Thus, in order to support this farming, Mrs. Meas would like to ask for a loan. 

Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: to support a dry season rice crop

loans.name: Mrs. Son Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of ten people who will use their portions of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' standard of living. 

Mrs. Son, who was born in 1979, has been selected by all the members to be the village bank president. She is a fruit seller in the local market where she can earn some profit to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Tuo, is a recycling seller and a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he can grow rice. He sells some part of the rice and rest of the rice he uses to support his family. This couple supports three children who are attending local public school. 

Since her business is getting on well, Mrs. Son wants to expand. So to improve her daily income, Mrs. Son is asking for a loan to buy more fruits to resell. With the rest of the loan, she is going to buy more recycling.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to resell

loans.name: Enkhbaatar

texts.en: Enkhbaatar is 40 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live in a small wooden house, which he recently build on his own land. Enkhbaatar's wife, Naranchimeg, is 40 and operates a clothes retail business from a rented stall at the market. His two children attend a local secondary school. Enkhbaatar has been running a transportation business for the last five years. He transports coal, firewood and construction materials. He is a very hardworking, optimistic person whose goal is to extend his business and provide his children with a good education. Enkhbaatar is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase some construction materials to finish the house that he recently built.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to finish his house

loans.name: Keng's Group

texts.en:
The four members of this group loan have selected Mrs. Keng to be the group leader. They will use their portions of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' standard of living. 

Mrs. Keng and her husband, Mr. Khor, are farmers who own a one-hectare plot of land where they grow rice. They sell part of the rice and the rest of the rice they use to support their family. They also sell ice cream door to door. They have three children who are studying in local public school. 

Although they work hard, they can earn only a little income, so to improve this condition, Mrs. Keng is applying for a loan. She wants to buy some piglets and pig food for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: to buy some piglets and pig food

loans.name: Emmalinda

texts.en:
Emmalinda R., 41, is making sure that her family has enough for their daily needs. She is married to Joselito R., a buko (coconut) juice vendor, and they are blessed with two children, one in elementary education and the other in high school. Emmalinda, a college graduate, helps her husband earn a living so they will be able to send their children to college. Together, they live in Lalaan 1, Silang, Cavite, Philippines.
Emmalinda has been managing her own buko (young coconut) salad and buko juice business for ten years now. Coconut water (buko juice, in the Philippines) is the liquid inside young coconuts. It’s watery and only subtly coconut flavored – sort of sweet and grassy. Young coconut juice can be used as a sports drink or a simple beverage that is usually sold in Filipino restaurants. Emmalinda, along with her husband, used to sell fresh buko juice and buko salad among her neighbors and in the local community. Monthly, she earns an estimated net income of around 12,000 PHP.
To help her continue operation of her business, Emmalinda is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP. She plans to use this loan to purchase more fresh young coconuts to sell and other raw materials needed for her buko salad business. She believes she will see an increase in her earning capacity as a microentrepreneur through this loan. Emmalinda dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can have enough money for her children’s college education. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy fresh young coconuts for resale and other ingredients needed for her buko business

loans.name: Mr. Touch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has 17 people, each of whom will each use their loan portion to improve their family's living standard.  Touch, the village bank president selected by the other members, is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land upon which he grows rice both to sell  and to feed his family. His wife, a balut-egg seller, is able to earn some profit to help support the family. 

Eager to start a new business, Touch is requesting a loan to buy some piglets for breeding. He is the father of four children, two of whom are construction workers, one a driver, and one a student in a local public school.

loans.use: to buy some piglets for breeding

loans.name: Popoul's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of five members who have selected Mrs. Popoul as the group leader. Each member will use their loan portion to support a variety of purposes.

Mrs. Popoul and her husband are farmers who own a plot of land upon which they grow rice for their family living. Additionally, her husband sells Khmer natural medicine. Mrs. Popoul is now requesting a loan to support her crop production.  This couple has a child who is a wedding chef.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies

loans.name: Shijirmaa

texts.en: Shijirmaa is 33 years old and lives with her mother, younger brother and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a one-bedroom studio apartment that they rent. Shijirmaa's mother is retired and her son attends a local secondary school. Since 2008 Shijirmaa has been running a small grocery store from a rented stall at the "Burd market". Her business has been expanding since then. In Mongolia, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to members of the local neighborhood. Shijirmaa is the only breadwinner in her family, and she supports her elderly mother, younger brother and only son. Her future plan is to buy her own apartment. Therefore she is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to increase her working profit by adding some working capital.

loans.use: to have access to working capital

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda C. is 61 years old and her husband, Nolasco, is also 61. The couple has been farming for 40 years now. Nolasco also drives for a living. They have six children who have finished their college education. Esmeralda helps her husband earn a living by managing a variety store, which is adjacent to their house. They live together in the breezy town of Silang, Cavite.
When they are in season, Esmeralda trades bananas, pineapples and other crops from their farm in the nearby market. But while waiting for the harvest to come in, she attends to her general store (as shown in the picture). Monthly, she earns an estimated income of around 12,000 PHP. Esmeralda is proud to declare that her children finished college out of the couple's earnings. She was also able to purchase a jeepney, which they are now using to deliver fruits and other crops to the market.
To help her continue operation of her business, Esmeralda is requesting a loan of 24,000 PHP. She plans to use this amount to purchase additional grocery items for her store. She will use part of this loan to fund the next cropping of their pineapple farm. Esmeralda believes that through this loan, she will be able to increase her earning capacity as a microentrepreneur.
Esmeralda wishes to become wealthier so she can help her poor neighbors and relatives. Her usual prayers include good health and harmonious relationships amongst her children. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items for her store and fund the next cropping of pineapples

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and other supplies

loans.name: Prak's Group

texts.en:
This group group loan consists of five members. Mrs. Prak is the group leader. She was selected to be the group leader by the others members. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different purpose. 

Mrs. Prak is 49 years old and is a widow with a child who is attending a local school. 

Mrs. Prak is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to grow rice for a living. Now she wants to grow rice in the dry season, but she doesn't have enough money to support it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticide for supporting her farming crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticide for supporting a dry season rice crop

loans.name: Alba Claribel

texts.es: Alba Claribel G. de treinta y cuatro años de edad,vive con su compañero de vida  y sus tres hijos en Candelaria la frontera, en el departamento de Santa Ana. Ella posee un negocio ubicado en un lugar muy concurrido de Candelaria de La Frontera, donde vende bolsones y carteras de diferentes estilos, tiene  clientela pues tiene variedad de mercadería y siempre satisface a todas las personas que la visitan, estar a la orden del cliente es su lema. Alba quiere ver crecer su negocio y es así como se decidió solicitar a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar más mercadería como carteras, bolsones para niños y adultos. Alba tiene muchos sueños y confía que su negocio le ayudara a salir adelante para así lograr una vida plena junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Alba Claribel G. is 34 years old and lives with her partner and three children in Candelaria de la Frontera in the department of Santa Ana.  She has a stall in a very busy area of Candelaria de la Frontera where she sells bags and satchels in different styles.  She has many customers because of her variety of merchandise and she always satisfies the people who visit her.  Her motto is to give the customer what he/she wants.

Alba wants to grow her business so decided to request a loan through INTEGRAL to buy satchels and bags for children and adults.  She has many dreams and is confident her business will help her get ahead so she can live a fulfilling life together with her family.

loans.use: To buy satchels, bags and backpacks

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es: Candelaria G. D. M. D. cuarenta y cinco años D. edad vive en casa propia con su hija y nieta, en San Martin, departamento D. San Salvador. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio con muy buena ubicación, en el mercado D. San Martin donD. venD. diferentes tipos D. ropa. Candelaria ya posee mucha clientela pues se caracteriza por ser muy servicial y al mismo tiempo siempre tiene lo que las personas necesitan; Ella quiere ver crecer su negocio y le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito con el que pueda comprar  más ropa como camisas, vestidos, pantalones, shorts para el verano que se aproxima, entre otros. D. esta forma Candelaria como toda mujer con metas planea salir adelante, solventar su hogar y dar a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Candelaria G. D. M. is 45 years old and lives in her own house with her daughter and granddaughter in San Martin in the department of San Salvador.  She has a small business in a good location in the San Martin market where she sells different types of clothing.

Candelaria has many customers because she is so attentive and always has what people are looking for.  She wants to grow her business and so has requested a loan through INTEGRAL to buy more clothing such as shirts, dresses, trousers and shorts for the upcoming summer season.  

Like all women, Candelaria wants to get ahead and give her family the best she can.

loans.use: To buy shirts, dresses, trousers and blouses

loans.name: Kheav's Group

texts.en:
There are five people who are forming this group loan. Mrs. Kheav, who was born in 1951, is the group leader. She was selected as the group leader by the others members. The members of this group will use their portions to support their different purposes.

Mrs. Kheav and her husband are farmers who own a plot of land that they use to grow rice, but they do not have enough money to grow it. Thus, Mrs. Kheav would like to ask for a loan to pay for hiring laborers to plow her rice field and to buy fertilizers and pesticides for growing rice. 

This couple has three children who are employed in garment factories.

loans.use: to pay for hiring laborers to plow her rice field and to buy fertilizers and pesticides for growing rice

loans.name: Mrs. Sao Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The 16 people who make up this village bank loan have selected Mrs. Sao to be the village bank president. They will use their portions of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' standard of living. 

Mrs. Sao is a chicken breeder and a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband is a cripple. This couple supports four children. Two are employed in garment factories, one is a construction worker, and the other is studying in the local public school. 

Now she wants to start a new business, so she needs some money to support it. Mrs. Sao is applying for a loan to buy some piglets for breeding.

loans.use: To buy some piglets for breeding

loans.name: José María

texts.es: José María V. G. de cuarenta y tres años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos en San Martin, del departamento de San Salvador. El posee un taller de enderezado y pintura de automóviles en un lugar muy  concurrido de San Martin, es un negocio muy rentable pues ya tiene mucha clientela por su calidad de trabajo y sus buenos precios; pero últimamente José ha tenido más demanda de trabajo y no posee con todo lo necesario para realizarlo, es por eso que se decidió a solicitar a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar más pintura de carro,  de diferentes colores para poder satisfacer a todos sus clientes. José es todo un hombre de familia y espera que en un futuro su negocio le ayude a solventar todas las necesidades de su hogar y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: José María V. G. is 43 years old and lives with his life partner and two children in San Martin, department of San Salvador. He has a repair and automobile shop in a heavily trafficked area in San Martin; it is a very profitable business since he has a lot of customers because of the quality of his work and his good prices. Lately though, José has had more demand for his work and does not have the necessary tools to do it all, this is why he went to INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow him to buy more car paint in different colors to be able to satisfy all of his customers. José is family man and hopes in the future for his business to help him meet all of his household expenses and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy car paint.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy silk thread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy flour, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Mrs. Khem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of 14 people who will use their portions of the loan for different purposes that can improve their families' standard of living. Mrs. Khem is the village bank president, who has been selected by the other members. 

She is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land where she can grow rice. She sells some part of the rice and rest of the rice she uses to support her family. 

Her husband, Mr. Sarun, is a construction worker and a farming laborer. Through this activity, they support two children who are attending local public school. 

In the rice field, she has a problem because her field is infertile soil. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Khem is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, rice seed and pesticide.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seed and pesticide

loans.name: Kheav's Group

texts.en:
The five people who make up this group loan have selected Mrs. Kheav to become the group leader. They will use their portions of the loan in various ways to improve their families' standard of living. 

Mrs. Kheav is a widow with a child who is a laborer. She is a tailor at home who is able to earn a small income to support her family. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fabrics to increase her business activities.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics to increase her business activities

loans.name: Rinah Grace

texts.en:
Rinah Grace is 38 years old, married and has two children. Her children are two and four years old. She is a farmer working in Surallah, South Cotabato. She has been growing rice for three years. Rinah Grace usually earns about 5,000 PHP from this farming. She also owns and manages a sari-sari store where she sells items such as sugar and shampoo.
Rinah Grace's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes that her farm and store businesses will grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rodora

texts.en: Rodora is a 34-year-old married mother of two children, aged five and four months. She grows rice and corn to earn a living. She tills land in Surallah, South Cotabato. Rodora sells her harvest to the people in her community. She works hard to support her family. Rodora has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes that her business will grow and dreams for her children to be successful in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie L., a high school graduate, is married to Recto L., a school service driver. They have been blessed with six children who are still studying. Together, they live in Ilayang Pulo, Silang, Cavite, Philippines.
Rosalie has raised ornamental plants in her home yard for years now. She manages a plant nursery where she takes care of and sells ornamental and flowering plants. This business has been providing for her family for many years. She also manages the operation of their motorized tricycle transport business. She earns an estimated net income of around 14,000 PHP per month.
To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a loan of 21,000 PHP. She plans to use this amount to purchase additional young ornamental plants to raise and sell. She will also use part of the loan for the maintenance of their motorized tricycle unit.
Rosalie dreams of having a car or van to be used as a delivery vehicle for customers' orders outside their town. She prays for good health and for her children to be able to finish their college education. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional young ornamental plants and other planting materials

loans.name: Rosabel

texts.en:
Rosabel is a married woman living in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato, with her family. She has four children, the oldest of whom is 18 years old.
Rosabel is a farmer. She primarily grows rice crops that she sells to the market. She also raises goats, which she sells as well. Rosabel has requested a loan to fund her farm. She will purchase farm fertilizers and other supplies. Rosabel works hard to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm fertilizers and other supplies

loans.name: Savany's Group

texts.en:
The three people who make up this group loan will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes that can improve their family's standard of living. 

Mr. Savany is the group leader who has been selected by the other members. He is a teacher and a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he can grow rice. He sells some part of the rice yield and with the rest of the rice, he supports his family.

 In the rice field, he has some problems because his field has infertile soil. So to improve rice production, Mr. Savany is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide. His wife, Mrs. Im, is a laborer in Thailand. He is the father of four children, one of whom is a silk weaver, while the others are studying in a local public school. 

Mrs. Khoeun Nut is the group guarantor, so she is presented in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 48 years old, married and has three children. Her oldest child is 26 years old and the youngest is 19. Rosemarie's husband works as a farmer.
Rosemarie grows pigs to earn a living. She maintains a small piggery where she fattens the pigs that she will sell to the market. Rosemarie makes sure her pigs grow healthy because they will then be easier to sell. She has requested a loan to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies. Rosemarie's wish is for her business to grow in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok was born in 1950 and is the group leader. She was selected to be the group leader by its five members. Each member of this group will use their money to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Sok and her husband, Mr. Sim are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to grow corn for their family. Aside from being farmers, they also earn their living by making mats to sell. In order to increase their income to improve the family's living conditions, Mrs. Sok would like to ask for a loan to buy mat supplies to support her mat business. 

This couple has three children: two are employed in a garment factory while the last one is attending a local school.

loans.use: To buy mat supplies to support her mat business.

loans.name: 6  Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Thảo Lê Thị (31) is a 46-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Thảo is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02.07.1.6 Nam Ngạn (6 Nam Ngạn).
Thảo is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Thảo owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising cattle for sale. Thảo has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND per month from these activities.
In 2009, Thảo joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND, which will also be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. The loan will be her third from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thảo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the other borrowers in the group
1. Lê Thị Thanh (29) is a 46-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall. 2. N. Thị Bình (30) is a 44-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. 3. T. Thị Thêm (32) is a 37-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women
The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Thảo Lê Thị (31) là 46 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa. Thảo là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02.07.1.6 Nam Ngạn (6 Nam Ngạn). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán. Thảo thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Thảo kiếm được khoảng 1,500,000 VND. Vào 2009, Thảo đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Thảo đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Lê Thị Thanh (29) là 46 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. 2. Ngyễn Thị Bình (30) là 44 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. T. Thị Thêm (32) là 37 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie is a married woman with two children aged 19 and 26. Rosemarie is engaged in farming. She grows rice to sell to the community. She also raises goats and sells them as well. Rosemarie works hard to support her family. She will use this loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Habibullo

texts.ru: Амирхонов Хабибулло проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 45 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Хабибулло занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет участок земли, где выращивает овощи и сажает фруктовые деревья. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 10 лет. Целью кредита является закуп семян для весеннего посева.
texts.en: Habibullo A. lives in the Hamadoni district.  He is 45 years old, married and has 4 children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Habibullo is involved in agriculture.  He has a plot of land by his house, where he grows vegetables and plants fruit trees.  He has been involved in this business for 10 years.  The goal of this loan is to purchase seeds for the spring sowing.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
At 31, Daisy B. still has to make an effort to achieve a sense of accomplishment. She presently resides in Kaong, Silang, Cavite with her one child and runs her own microbusiness. Daisy is married to Napoleon, a driver, who works very hard to earn a living to be able to send her child to college.
Daisy is already at a point where other dreams lie. She already has her own variety store, which she established in her community two years ago. She offers basic commodities such as groceries, rice, beverages, generic drugs, soaps and condiments among others. Every month, she earns an estimated net income of around 10,000 PHP.
To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP. With this loan, she will secure supplies for her grocery store including food items, rice, school supplies and other items that are usually in demand among her customers. Daisy believes that this loan will increase her earning capacity as a microentrepreneur.
Daisy dreams of a simple yet happy life with her family and of sending her child all the way through college. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting. She can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives at these meetings.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to restock her variety store

loans.name: Jeanelyn

texts.en:
Jeanelyn A., 39, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Roel A., a businessman, the couple is blessed with four children. Jeanelyn makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.
Jeanelyn has operated a variety store for four years now. In the Philippines, a variety store is a place to go to buy 5-PHP worth of cooking oil, a sachet of shampoo or an egg. What Jeanelyn basically does is purchase these items at wholesale prices and retails them with minimum mark-up. She finds the store easy to manage since it is located adjacent to her house. Monthly, she earns an estimated net income of around 10,000 PHP.
Now with your help, she would like to apply for a loan of 8,000 PHP. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying products to replenish her inventory. Jeanelyn expects an increase in earnings through the use of this loan. She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can have a good and comfortable life with her family. She also prays for good health and that she will be able to send her children all the way through college. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for her store

loans.name: Jargalsaikhan

texts.en: Jargalsaikhan is 49 years old and the father of seven children. He lives with his wife and youngest daughter in Darkhan city. They live together in a small wooden house on their own plot of land. Jargalsaikhan's youngest daughter, Zoljargal, 13, attends a local secondary school. His wife worked at the railway station as a cashier for 30 years and is now retired. Since 2006, Jargalsaikhan has operated an auto repair business in his yard and has built a successful operation with a loyal customer base. Jargalsaikhan is a helpful person with a good personality. He is planning to expand his business by building a garage. He says, "My dream is one day to change my repair place into a large and warm auto repair service". He is requesting a loan to purchase some construction materials to fix his old house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to fix his old house

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica works hard to support her family. Angelica has a common-law husband and a sari-sari store business in the Philippines.

Angelica requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock for her sari-sari store.

Angelica has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Angelica would like to repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a married woman with seven children. Her oldest child is 19 years old. Rosie makes candies for a living. Her bestseller is yema, which is a sweet concoction made of milk and egg yolks. Rosie sells her candies to schools and around her community. She also grows pineapples and sells the fruits to the market.
Rosie's loan will be used to purchase ingredients such as milk and sugar. Rosie hopes that her business will grow in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as milk and sugar

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie works hard to support her family. Lenie is single and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines.

Lenie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products to sell.

Lenie has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Lenie would like to save for her education.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from rice retailing.  Lolita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more stock for her general store business.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities for the  past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more basic items to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is a married woman with two children. She is 36 years old and has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for one year.

Shirley sells items like coffee and toothpaste to the people in her community. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods and sugar.

In the future, Shirley hopes to have a bigger store. She also wants her children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase items like canned goods and sugar

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia works hard to support her family. Cresencia is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Cresencia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Cresencia has been in this business for eight years.

In the future, Cresencia would like to improve her business and have savings for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her general store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
54-year-old Socorro is a married woman with five children. Her oldest child is 36 years old and the youngest is 23.

Socorro is engaged in farming. She grows rice crops and then sells her harvest to the market. She also owns and manages a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells vinegar, soy sauce and other kinds of products. She also cooks food that she displays at the store.

Socorro's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Evelyn is 50 years old and has two children who are in school.

Evelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase bananas and other root crops for her food products.

Evelyn has been in this business for two years.  In the future, Evelyn would like to send her kids to school.

loans.use: To buy root crops and bananas to make food to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy carrots and peppers to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 48 years old and is a married woman with 2 children. Her children are 19 and 16 years old. 

Susan makes candies to earn a living. She makes yema (a sweet concoction made of milk and egg yolks) and other kinds of candies. She also has a small banana farm. She makes banana cue (deep-fried banana covered with caramelized brown sugar) that she sells around the neighborhood.

Susan has requested a loan to purchase sugar, milk and other ingredients for candy-making. She hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, milk and other ingredients for candy-making

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
A Spanish proverb goes, "An ounce of blood is worth more than a pound of friendship." Violeta C., 52, knows the importance of the family and seeks ways to solve familial issues. Violeta is a high school graduate. At present she runs her own business as she actively participates in CCT* fellowships as a community partner and runs her household as its head. She lives with her family in Pasay City, Metro Manila.

Violeta sells 3-in-1 coffee manufactured by a brand called DXN. She also buys and sells other merchandise such as rice and apparel. For eight years, she has been working with her home as her commercial space. She usually sells her merchandise to neighbors, community friends, and business connections. With her all-out perseverance, she is able to earn about $233 a month on average.

To help her continue the operation of her businesses, she is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP.  She will use this amount to purchase DXN products such as the 3-in-1 coffee, bottles of vitamins (food supplements), and toothpastes. She also intends to buy sacks of rice for retailing, as well as some apparel for resale. Violeta recognizes the loan as highly helpful in increasing her earnings so that she can meet her family's needs.

Violeta finds it challenging to follow up on the payments of her neighbors, due to the Filipino culture of saving the face of one who refuses or is incapable of paying debts. Another challenge is her children who are already grown up and have their own families, but who refuse to build their own homes and earn their own money. Violeta seeks to find ways to settle both her business and personal issues, and to restore familial relationships. She desires to have her own commercial space. Also, she prays that her children will soon be able to find work.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for boxes of 3-in-1 coffee ordered in advance by customers and also to pay for sacks of rice for resale

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a married woman who lives in Surallah, South Cotabato with her family. She has eight children.

Tessie is a farmer. She grows rice crops and then sells her harvest to the market. She has been engaged in rice farming for 25 years. Tessie works hard to improve her business and support her family.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 43 years old and is a married woman with five children. Her oldest child is 25 years old and the youngest is 17.

Thelma is a farmer working in Surallah, South Cotabato. She primarily grows rice crops. She sells her harvest to the people in her community. Thelma works hard to support her family. She wants to help improve their living conditions.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 45 years old and married with two children.

Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Teresita has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for three years.

Teresita aspires to expand her business and have her house repaired.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add more utensils for his cafe.

loans.name: Fede

texts.en:
Fede is 35 years old and married with one child.

Fede works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Fede has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from a videoke machine.

Fede aspires to expand her business and have her house repaired.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kombo

texts.en:
Kombo S. is a 65-year-old married man who has four children. He operates a retail shop in the Marereni area in Malindi town. The business has been in existence for the past six years now and it usually gives Kombo a monthly income of about Kshs. 5000/=. He uses this income to support his small family since all his children are grown up. 

Kombo has been loaned Kshs 12,000/= by KADET LIMITED and this serves as his second loan from the company. He intends to use this loan to buy foodstuffs such as cooking flour, soft drinks such as sodas as well as other items like cooking oil, toothpaste, sweets for children so as to add to the stock that he already has. 

He wishes to use the anticipated profit from the business to continue looking after his family as well as continue restocking and gradually expanding his business so that in future, his family may come to own a well-established retail shop in the area.

loans.use: To add stock to his retail shop.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Felisa works hard to support her family.

She has a manicure/pedicure (services) business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from frozen foods.  Felisa is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy various kinds of cosmetics for her manicure/pedicure (services) business.

Felisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dreams of sending her kids to school and having savings for her family.

loans.use: to prchase cosmetics for her manicure/pedicure business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Houssein

texts.en:
Houssein is a 65-year-old married man, living in Baalback with his wife and one child. Houssein has been selling clothes for 28 years. He is well known in his region and most of his clients are his neighbors and relatives. In addition to clothes Houssein sells medical shoes.

 Houssein is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy a new seasonal collection at a special price. This is Houssein's second loan with Al Majmoua. His previous loan had a very good effect on his business, in addition to his social situation. Houssein hopes to continue working in spite of his old age.

loans.use: To buy a new seasonal collection.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 39 years old and married with one child.

Carmelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Carmelita has borrowed and paid back 29 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Carmelita aspires to own a mini grocery store someday.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius B. is a 42-year-old married man with five children. He has been operating a retail shop in Marereni town in Malindi for the past 10 years now. Julius earns a monthly income of about KES 10,000 that he uses to take care of his family. 

He has been loaned KES 30,000 by KADET Ltd., and this serves as his third loan cycle from the company. He intends to use his loan to add stock such as toothpastes, soft drinks, bottled drinking water, tooth brushes, cooking flour, cooking oil and other things that are running low in the shop.

He wishes to use the anticipated profits from the business to continue taking care of his family and educating his children as well as saving some of the money for future investments.

loans.use: to add stock to his retail shop

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a widow with five children. One of the children is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilyn is 48 years old.

Marilyn has a general store business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more products to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for five years.  In the future, Marilyn would like to send her kids to school to get better jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more products for the store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria is 51 years old and married with three children. Gleceria works very hard to provide for them.

Gleceria runs a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

Gleceria has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of fish such us dried squid, tabagak, palad etc. Gleceria also earns income from sewing/tailoring.

In the future, Gleceria would like to put up a dried fish stall in the market.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Нозимова Насиба проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 32 года. Замужем, имеет двоих детей. Муж находится в России. Сама Насиба предоставляет услугу. Она более 10 лет занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Этим видом деятельности занимается у себя дома. Кредит берет для покупки цветных ниток и тканей.
texts.en: Nasiba N. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 32 years old, married and has two children. Her husband works in Russia. Nasiba provides a service, she has been sewing national Tajik dresses for more than ten years. She does this business from home. She is taking out the loan to buy color threads and fabrics.

loans.use: to buy color threads and fabrics

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane works hard to support her family. Mary Jane has a common-law husband and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Mary Jane requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fresh fish to sell.

Mary Jane has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save money for her child's education.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Benter

texts.en:
Benter Diang’a is a 39-year-old married lady with four children. She has been selling fish in Maweni Town in Malindi for the past nine years now and she gets a monthly income of about KES 10,000 from the business. 

Benter has been loaned KES 20,000 by KADET Ltd., which is her first loan cycle from the company. She plans to use the money to put up a wooden structure that would serve as her business premise, add fish stock to the business and buy a new weighing machine for her business. 

Benter wishes to use the anticipated profits from her business to assist her husband in taking care of the family and to save some for future investments.

loans.use: to build a structure, add more fish stock and buy a scale for her business

loans.name: Somoe

texts.en:
Somoe is a widow with two school-aged children.  They live in a rental house with electricity, but no piped water.  School fees are her greatest monthly expense.

For over ten years, she has operated a business selling fruit to her neighhors from her home.  Somoe faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. The demand for soft drinks is lower during the rainy, cold season, but the demand increases in the hot, summer season.  Somoe is requesting a KSH 25,000 loan to purchase sacks of fruit and sugar to make natural fruit juice for sale.  Somoe dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fruit and sugar to make natural fruit juice for sale.

loans.name: Enosi

texts.en: Enosi is a 55-year-old businessman who operates a retail shop.  He also runs a cafeteria.  He started the store business twelve years ago.  He has been able to finance his business with loans from Faulu Kenya.  He has managed to see his children through school, thanks to Faulu Kenya.  He hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future.  He has requested 20,000 KES to add to his stock of sugar, tea leaves, salt, soda, maize flour and bread.

loans.use: to add to his stock of sugar, tea leaves, salt, soda, maize flour and bread.

loans.name: Mpa-Atabulira Kizinga Group-Jinja

texts.en: 47-year-old K. Robinah has been in the motorcycle transportation business for close to three years now. Most of the motorcycle riders she has hired operate from Kizinga, Mpa-atabulira in Jinja. This mother of eleven is testament to the fact that females can also play first fiddle in a male dominated business genre. Before she set forth in this business, she was engaged in an agro sales business. She dispensed with it later and used her savings to buy a motorcycle. At present she also has a pig husbandry business. She says her weekly profits are about $42. With this loan, she says she is going to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina works hard to support five children. Ludivina is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Ludivina requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for fishing boat repairs.

Ludivina has been in this business for 27 years. Ludivina earns more income with pig fattening.

In the future, Ludivina would like to purchase an additional fishing boat.

loans.use: to purchase materials for fishing boat repairs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a businessman who operates a motorbike (boda-boda) transport business.  He has been running the business for three years with one employee.  Besides, he is employed.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been economically empowered; hence, he has grown his business.  He hopes to buy more motorbikes in the future.  With 20,000 KES, he will repair his motorbike and open a grocery shop.

loans.use: to repair his motorbike and open a grocery shop

loans.name: Tsetseglen

texts.en:
Tsetseglen D., 45, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in their own house on a small plot of land that they own. They have an average standard of living. 

Her husband and her two elder daughters do work and support their family. Tsetseglen began selling souvenirs in 2009. In the beginning she used to purchase and sell souvenirs at a rented stall. Now she makes souvenirs by herself and sells them at her stall. One of her daughters also operates a stall. 

She is a hardworking person with initiative who says, "I make souvenirs at home and it is difficult. Therefore, I want to expand my business and have my own workshop in near future." 

She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for making souvenirs

loans.name: Kahati

texts.en:
Kahati M. is a widow with one married child. She owns a house that does not have electricity or piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food. For over 30 years, she has operated a makuti (palm leaves used in roofing houses) business, selling as retail to house contractors and those with business premises. 

The business has helped and improved her mode of living. She faces a challenge in the high cost of transportation in the business. Kahati dreams of expanding the business in the future. 

With the KES 30,000 she is requesting she wants to purchase more palm leaves for sale. She joined Yehu Microfinance to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase palm leaves to sell for roofing houses

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas M. W. is a 36-year-old businessman who run a a cafeteria. He started the business four years ago. Apart from running a cafeteria, he does sugarcane farming so as to supplement his family’s income. He was previously operating a butcher shop.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has gained business ideas and developed business management skills. He hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future. He has requested 15,000 KES to buy an energy-saving cooker, called a jiko.

loans.use: to buy an energy-saving cooker (jiko)

loans.name: Lê's Group

texts.en:
T. Lê Thị  (20206030050) is a 26-year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  T. is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Yên Hậu nhóm 06 (Nhóm 06).


T. is married and has one infant child.  To make a living, T. operates a family member's business venture in the manufacturing sector.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing & selling wood products to local businesses and community members.  T. has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,496,000 VND which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional wood products.  This will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Trần Thị T. (20206030045) is a 30 year-old female who is requesting a 7.840.000 VND loan to support her business making & selling food.


2.  Vũ Thị H. (20206030063) is a 26 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.


3.  Nghiêm Thị Hạnh (20206030034) is a 24 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business making & selling food.


4.  Kiều V. L. (20206030051) is a 35 year-old male who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support his service-based business.


5.  Kiều  Thị H. (20206030052) is a 43 year-old female who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support her service-based business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Lê Thị  (20206030050) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Yên Hậu nhóm 06 (Nhóm 06).


Trong khi không pH. chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng gỗ cho các doanh ngH. và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2009, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư đổi mới công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.496.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Trần Thị T. (20206030045) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.840.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


2.  Vũ Thị H. (20206030063) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


3.  Nghiêm Thị Hạnh (20206030034) là 24 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


4.  Kiều V. L. (20206030051) là 35 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


5.  Kiều  Thị H. (20206030052) là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh NgH. Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional wood products.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. O. is a 39-year-old member of Huruma B group in Faulu, Kenya. She runs a grocery store to earn a living. Being a widowed lady with five children in school, she works hard in her business so as to educate them. She also does farming to make ends meet.  

She hopes to grow her business so that she may be financially stable in the future. She has requested 20,000 KES to buy tomatoes and onions.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine M. is 34-year-old married lady with four children all below the age of 18 years. She has been a water vendor for the last seven years now in Marereni area in Malindi and earns a monthly income of about Kshs 21,000/= from her business. She usually uses the money to assist her husband in taking care of their family and educating their children. 

Josephine has been loaned Kshs 40,000/= by KADET LIMITED as her third loan from the company and she intends to use it to purchase a bigger water tank than the one she has now. She would like to be able to serve her ever-growing customer base since no one else conducts the same kind of business in the area. 

She wishes to use the anticipated profits from her business to continue helping look after her family as well as to help grow her business by opening another water selling point in the town.

loans.use: To purchase a new water tank for her business.

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.en:
Pelagia is married with two children. One of her children is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Pelagia is 45 years old.  

Pelagia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Pelagia requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase various kinds of fish to sell.

Pelagia has been in this business for five years.  In the future, Pelagia would like to improve her fish vending business and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase various kinds of fish to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn works hard to support four children. Roselyn is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Roselyn requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy materials to repair a fishing boat.

Roselyn has been in this business for 20 years. Roselyn earns more income with a business buying and selling boneless danguet (fish).

In the future, Roselyn would like to buy an additional fishing boat.

loans.use: Buy materials for the repair of fishing boat

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala N. is a 46-year-old lady, married to Sameer, age 52, and has 6 children. She is a committed volunteer at the handicap club helping the less privileged in their day-to-day challenges. 

Hala has worked in the nursing industry since 1988, so she decided to combine her nursing experience and skills along with her passion to help those with special needs to start a therapeutic center that includes physiotherapy, Chinese cupping, and other forms of therapeutic massage.

In order to make her dream come true, Hala continued studying and achieved many certificates in the field of physiotherapy and special needs therapies and has been practicing these therapies at home for four years now. Hala is also working at a beauty salon where she managed to establish a wide client base. 

Now Hala wants to take a loan in order to broaden her practice and open a therapeutic center of her own, equipped with the latest physiotherapy devices and therapeutic tools for her to help as many patients as possible.

loans.use: To open a therapeutic center of her own

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen M. O. is 30 years old, married and blessed with a 2-year-old child. 

She operates a cosmetic shop and a pharmacy to earn a living. She works hard in her business so that she can help her husband with household expenses. She hopes to expand her business into wholesale in the future.  

She has requested 15,000 KES to buy body lotion, nail polish and oils.

loans.use: to  buy body lotion, nail polish and oils

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is married with two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Robina is 44 years old. 

Robina has a biscuit vending business in the Philippines. Robina requested a PHP 49,500 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of biscuits to sell.

Robina has been in this business for seven years.  In the future, Robina would like to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase more biscuits to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a single woman with two school-going children. They live in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past seven years, she has operated a beverage-selling business. She sells retail to passersby and the neighbouring community. 

Zeinab faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  With the Kshs 25,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase beverages for sale.

loans.use: To purchase beverages for resale.

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en:
Raeda is a young woman from Hebron, married and the mother of one daughter and three sons. Raeda's husband is an employee with a decent salary.

Raeda bought home furniture, a bedroom for her four-year-old daughter, a kitchen table and chairs. Since her husband can't pay the price of the above-mentioned items at once, she took a loan from FATEN to pay the stores and pay FATEN on monthly basis.

Raeda's husband appears in the picture here instead of her since she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: to pay for home furniture and kitchen set

loans.name: Otgontuya

texts.en:
Otgontuya T. is widowed and lives with her two children in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her son attends a college and her daughter goes to a local secondary school. 

She used to work as food quality-control specialist for a local bakery between 2005 and 2011. She started to make and sell clothes besides her job in 2008. Then she began operating a new business in 2011 after quitting her job. 

She bought an oven, a stove and and other useful equipment and started selling homemade bread.
