She wants to expand her homemade bread business and increase her working capital in order to have her own bakery in the near future. She is a hardworking and modest person who says, "I want to save money for my children and give them a good education." 

Otgontuya is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase new ovens and equipment for her homemade bread business.

loans.use: To purchase new ovens and equipment

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan K. is a 61-years-old married man with three children. He operates a Posho mill business where he grinds dry seeds into flour in Marereni market in Malindi town. The business gives him a monthly income of about KES. 10,000/=.  He has been running this business for the last five years now.

Jonathan has been loaned Kshs 10,000/= by KADET LIMITED and this serves as his first loan from the company. He intends to use part of the loan to purchase spare parts for the "posho" mill and will use the rest to service it so that it works well. 

Jonathan wishes to utilize the anticipated profits to continue looking after his family and continue educating his children who are still in school. He would also like to save some of it so that  he will be able to purchase another "posho" mill in future with a view to grow the business.

loans.use: To repair and service his "posho" (cornmeal) mill

loans.name: Tô

texts.en:
N. Tô Thị  (20206030049) is a 52-year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc N.. She is married and has three adult children.  

To making a living, N. sells liquor such as beer and wine in the local community. N. has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, N. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. N. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,496,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering.  

N. is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND, which will be used to buy more products to meet the demand of customer. This will be the fourth loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About SEDA:
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro finance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


N. Tô Thị  (20206030049) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc N..  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, N. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán loại thức uống có cồn như bia & rượu trong cộng đồng địa phương.  N. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 1 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, N. kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, N. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  N. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các vật dụng mới để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  N. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện điều kiện sống chung của gia đình người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to buy more products to meet the demand of customers

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta O., 59, is a high school graduate who ventures into selling  pork, beef and chicken. She is married to Benigno O., 60, her business partner, and they are blessed with three working children. Together, they live in Banaba, Silang, Cavite, Philippines.

Violeta has been selling fresh meats including pork, beef and chicken for 20 years now. She gets her supply from butchers who have been family friends over the years. Together with her husband, she buys live animals from butchers, slaughters them and sells the meat to her neighbors, market stalls and the local community. She earns an estimated net monthly income of PHP 10,000.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will use this amount to pay for live pigs and chickens for slaughter. With this loan, Violeta expects to increase her earnings as a micro entrepreneur.

She dreams of a healthy and abundant life for her family and prays for the success of her business. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for live pigs and chickens for slaughter

loans.name: Ma. Helen

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ma. Helen is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Helen is 49 years old. 

Ma. Helen has a business buying and selling fermented fish (tinabal) in the Philippines. Ma. Helen requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish for her fermented fish business.

Ma. Helen has been in this business for 12 years.  In the future, Ma. Helen would like to put up a stall for selling fermented fish in the market.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en:
Sarantuya T. is 53 years old and lives with her husband in the Dornod province of Mongolia. They live in their own house on a small plot of land that they own. They have an average standard of living. 

All her children got married and they live on their own. Her husband drives a truck and operates a delivery service. 

She began retail trading of food and grocery in 2003. She rents a stall at a local market for her business and her daily net income is about 100,000 MNT. Her current working capital exceeds 1,000,000 MNT. 

Sarantuya is a hardworking and polite person. She wants to expand her business and increase her working capital. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase more grocery products from Ulaanbaatar for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products from Ulaanbaatar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
For Susana G., 44, being responsible matters, be it in business or in her personal life. Susana reached college and is now focusing on her own business. She is married to Reynaldo, a driver. They live in Caloocan City, Metro Manila. Susana is one of CCT*'s active community partners.

Susana runs her own plastic ware rolling store. Each day she looks into the sales, observes which are the best selling items, which are the best selling techniques, and so on. She has been only a year in this small business and manages it alone, but every month she is able to earn around PHP12,000.

To help her grow her business, Susana has asked for a loan of PHP 10,000. This money will go to the purchase of more quantities of plastic ware to be included in her inventory of products. She will invest in products that are saleable and needed by members of her community. Susana mentions that this loan will enable her to earn and pay her weekly obligations responsibly.

Just like her fellow community partners, the rainy seasons hamper Susana's business productivity. Instead of having a considerable number of customers, Susana finds her store abandoned when it rains. However, she finds ways to deal with this challenge, because she always keeps in mind her responsibilities as a micro entrepreneur and a wife. She continually strives to become more profitable.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.
 
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase plastic ware to include in her product inventory

loans.name: Faisal

texts.en:
Faisal is a 20-year-old man. He was able to open a small restaurant with his father that serves sandwiches and delicious dishes such as like "homos" (chickpea paste) and "fool" (broad beans) and "falafel".

Faisal has been working at the restaurant for almost two years now and has gained a lot of experience during this time. In order to expand and improve the restaurant, he applied for this loan to buy new equipment such as a larger fridge as a first step toward achieving his purpose.

loans.use: To buy new refrigerator for his restaurant.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah A. N. is a 31-year-old married lady with three children. 

She has nine years of experience in tailoring. 

She joined a group in Faulu Kenya where she saves her money on a weekly basis. Through the group, she is able to access business loans easily from Faulu Kenya because the members of the group guarantee each other's loans. 

She hopes to manage a big business in the future. Her dream is to open a tailoring school. She has requested 20,000 KES to buy a sewing machine, an overlock machine (for edging or hemming) and fabric.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, an overlock machine and fabric

loans.name: Munhjargal

texts.en:
Munhjargal D., 39, is married and lives with her husband and two children in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they own. 

Her husband drives a motorcycle taxi and both of her children attend a local secondary school. 

Munhjargal began retail trading of clothes in 2007. She has been cooperating with XacBank since she started her business and she is one of our reliable customers. She has begun operating a clothing making and repairing service in addition to her clothes trading business. 

Munhjargal is a hardworking and polite person who says, "I always work hard and try to increase my business revenues in order to save money for my children's future." 

She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase more clothes for her retail trading business and cloth and textiles for her new business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale as well as cloth and textiles

loans.name: Namizzi Central Group

texts.en:
Thirty-year-old G. Peter is a timber salesman operating from Jinja. The happy-go-lucky father of two has been in this business for eight years now. He says he was able to get established in this trade with profits from his first business, commercial farming--not that he has deserted it. He still finds time to go and tend to the crops in his gardens. Both of these businesses have required him to work hard. And in that regard he has not shortchanged himself. Peter is affiliated with Namizzi central group, and he says this business can generate him weekly profits to the tune of 250,000 shillings. He says with this loan he is going to purchase more timber to resell. 

In the group photo, three group members are not seen clearly, so I marked them as unpictured.

loans.use: to purchase more timber to resell

loans.name: Ma Victoria

texts.en:
Something will always be better than nothing. Ma Victoria G., 41, recognizes this in her life. She has not been able to finish her course in college, but she thinks it is better than not having learned anything at all. She is married to Alrafe, a self-employed aluminum installer. They have four children, of whom two are in college. The other two are studying in elementary. Their family resides in Caloocan City.

Victoria works with frozen foods as her primary products. She sells them to neighbors in the community who look for cheaper alternatives for meat, or those who wish for an easy fix for a meal. Also, Victoria sells siomai, which is a favorite food in their place. Having been in the food business two years, Victoria earns around 12,000 PHP every month.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP. She will add this money to her capital in order to improve her business. She will increase the number of products and invest in more best-selling products, such as hotdogs.

Victoria did not mention any specific challenge she has at present, though that does not indicate the absence of challenges in her life. Victoria continues to reach for more in life, as she cherishes what she has now. There could be more out there for her to achieve, but what she has now is better than having nothing at all.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meetings, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase frozen food for selling

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a married, 45-year-old man living in Baalbeck (Bekaa). He and his wife have four children. He owns and runs a library, and he explains that he has eight years of experience in this field.

He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase his library's capital and to buy a washing machine for his house. Thanks in large part to the fact that his library is located next to the town hall, many clients come to his shop for photocopies and printing services. His clients are friends and passersby, as well as town hall visitors. This would be his sixth loan cycle, and he reports that the previous loans he obtained affected his business in a very positive way. He hopes to expand his business by opening a second library in the future.

loans.use: To increase his library's working capital

loans.name: Dolgormaa,

texts.en: Dolgormaa, 49, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Govi-Altai Province in Mongolia. Her elder son works as a driver for a transportation company, and two younger daughters currently attend a college in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She began retail trading of souvenirs, domestic appliances, and domestic wares at a local market in 2004. Her husband helps her with the business. She is trying to expand her business and increase her working capital. She is one of the reliable customers of our bank. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to enlarge her space and purchase more goods for her business.

loans.use: to enlarge her space and purchase more goods

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 46-year-old man, married to two ladies and has 3 children: 2 sons and a daughter. 

Using his 12 years of experience in trading and business, Mohammad decided to start his own business by renting a shop to sell frozen goods two years ago. He has been successfully running it since then. 

Mohammad applied for a loan to expand his business; he will be using the loan to buy more display refrigerators to introduce new varieties of goods to cover the needs of the people in his area.

loans.use: to buy more display refrigerators to introduce new varieties of goods

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Siena

texts.en:
Siena is married with five children. Four of the children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Siena is 44 years old. 

Siena has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Siena requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in the market.

Siena has been in this business for 20 years.  In the future, Siena would like to finish the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell in the market

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Od-Ser

texts.en: Od-Ser, 39, is married and lives with her husband and two children in the Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they own. Her husband works as a driver for a local police station. Her elder daughter attends a college, and her younger daughter goes to a local school. Od-Ser began retail trading of plumbing supplies in 2003. She rents a stall at a large market that sells construction materials. Her business has become more stable now. Od-Ser wants to expand her business and increase her working capital. She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase more plumbing supplies for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more plumbing supplies

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a married, 43-year-old woman. She and her husband have an 18-year-old child. To earn a living, she works in the farming business sector. Specifically, she has been growing rice for 5 years, and she sells her harvest at the market. She explains that she works very hard to support her family, especially her child's educational needs because she would like for her child to be successful.

Daisy is seeking a loan in the amount of $100 (4,000 PHP) to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She truly believes that the loan will help her improve the business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita works hard to support three children. Warlita is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Warlita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for fishing boat repairs.

Warlita has been in this business for 25 years. 

In the future, Warlita would like to expand her fishing business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for fishing boat repairs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and one school-age child. He has been working in selling car spare parts for the last 10 years. And in 2009, he opened his own shop and began his car trade operation. He is thankful for his business income because it allows him to provide good life conditions to his family.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his shop’s inventory in order to increase his sales. He hopes that the loan will help him increase his profits by 15%. He is confident that his work will continue to be successful in the future.

loans.use: to increase his shop’s inventory

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma D. C., 54, lives with a "bayanihan" spirit or a spirit of communal unity in her heart. She is a community partner of CCT*, a wife to Harold, and a doting mother to her children who are in school. She has finished college and is now running her own business in the community where they live in Caloocan City.

Irma has a car rental business. But her focus as of the moment is her direct selling business, in which she sells products from beauty brand Avon and apparel brand Boardwalk to friends, business acquaintances, and neighbors. Irma has been doing this business for four years now. Monthly, Irma is able to earn an estimated net income of around 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP).

To help her bring this direct selling to the next level, Irma is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan. She will use this money to purchase more orders for delivery to her customers, such as perfumes, underwear garments, accessories, shoes, bags, and other beauty stuff. 

Irma says that vacations are hard moments in her business, as few customers come to her to order products. Nevertheless, she exerts her best effort in her business, because she desires to improve her family's living conditions. Remarkably, it is also her desire to help fellow community partners improve their living conditions. She takes her dream a step further by desiring to be an instrument to help others, fostering in them the "bayanihan" spirit along the way.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more orders for delivery to customers

loans.name: Davaadorj

texts.en:
Davaadorj, 31, is married and lives with his wife and son in UlaanB., the capital of Mongolia. They live in a ger, Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in someone's backyard on the outskirts of the city. 

He and his wife have worked together operating their tailor shop for the past six years. The shop they rent is located on a crowded street in the city center. Now their business has become much more stable and they have regular customers. As a reliable and well-known tailor shop, they always have custom orders. They are trying to expand their business and increase the variety of their products. They are planning increase their capacity and start making uniforms and suits in large quantities. 

Davaadorj is a hardworking person with initiative who says, "We think our future is bright. When you work hard, you always win something. Now, my wife and I are trying to expand our business and save money for our son's future." Davaadorj is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to purchase some more stitching machines in order to increase their work efficiency.

loans.use: to purchase some more stitching machines

loans.name: Henrietta

texts.en:
Henrietta is 49 years old and married with eight children. Two of her children are in school. Henrietta works very hard to provide for them.

Henrietta runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock.

Henrietta has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, salt, sardines, shampoo etc. Henrietta also earns income from fish vending.

In the future, Henrietta would like to purchase a fishing boat.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her sari-sari store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a married, 44-year-old man living in Nabatieh. He and his wife have five children. To earn a living, he works as a taxi driver, and he has 17 years of experience in this field. In the past, his main business challenge was competition from other drivers, but he now has regular clients, making his job more stable.

He is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua in order to do some necessary car maintenance and to pay for his daughter's wedding. This would be his fourth loan, and he reports that the previous loans he obtained were very helpful. In particular, he notes that the prior loans allowed him to fix his car and to thereby improve his family's standard of living. In the future, he hopes to buy a new car and to open his own transportation company.

loans.use: To pay for car maintenance

loans.name: Mahutin (Avotrou) Group

texts.en:
The Mahuting Avotroou group is comprised of three entrepreneurs, who are all in the same family. This would be their third loan from ALIDE now that they have successfully repaid their prior loans.

Isabelle (pictured with her hand raised) was born in 1969, and she now lives in Cotonou, Benin's largest city. She moved to her current home three months ago, and she now lives with her husband, Benjamin. She and Benjamin have four children, all of whom are in school.

For the past 25 years, Isabelle has run a stall where she sells motor oil to customers in her local neighborhood. This loan would enable her to purchase oil from a wholesale boutique in Cotonou. Her long-term goal is to strengthen her business by importing oil. She explains that she has good management skills and is prudent in her approach to business.

loans.use: To purchase additional motor oil

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
42-year-old Fatima is a married woman with six children. Her oldest child is 18 years old.

Fatima is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She has been growing rice for five years. She usually earns about 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month from this farming.

Fatima's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Kimberly

texts.en:
Kimberly is a young mother to a 1-year-old child. She is 20 years old and married to a farmer. Kimberly works at the farm with her husband. They till the land for planting and harvesting rice crops. At her young age, Kimberly has learned to work hard and support her family.

Kimberly's loan will be used to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies. She wishes for her business to improve.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Zaki

texts.en: Zaki is 60 years old, married, and has three children.  He is the owner of a manakish bakery. He lives in Nabatieh and has 37 years of experience in the field. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, which he will use to purchase products for his bakery such as flour, salt, oil ,etc. His clients are his village inhabitants. He used to have problems with competition but the good quality of his bakery permitted him to meet his customers' needs. This is Zaki's ninth loan cycle and he reports that the previous loans he obtained were very helpful for his bakery. Zaki is a good-standing borrower seldom late to repay. In the future, he hopes to improve his business and his income.

loans.use: To purchase products for his bakery, such as flour, salt, and oil

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 56-year-old married woman. She lives in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur with her family.

Maria is engaged in farming. She grows rice crops then sells her harvest to the people in her community. Maria said farming alone isn't enough to provide for all her family's needs. She opened a sari-sari store where she sells items like canned goods. She said that the store helps in their daily needs. Maria wishes for her businesses to improve.

Maria's loan will be used to purchase rice seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase rice seed, fertilizer, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 19-year-old, single, ambitious lady, who graduated from high school and lives with her three brothers and her twin sister.

Since she has a sense of responsibility towards her family, she took sewing training and got a professional certificate in that trade and starting practicing it at home. She bought a sewing machine and started a small business to help in supporting her family and has been doing that for 10 months.

Now she is applying for this loan to purchase a new sewing machine in order to increase her productivity, so she can be able to open her own sewing workshop and employ more people.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a rice farmer who works at Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She has been growing rice for 15 years. Esther sells her harvest to the people in her community. She currently needs seeds and fertilizers. She requested a loan of 5000 PHP to buy these. Esther hopes for her harvest to increase.

Esther is 46 years old and is a married woman with two children aged 14 and 15.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old single man living with his parents and one sibling. He is from Lebanon. He has worked as freelance textiles trader since 2003. He has worked in this domain for 10 years.  He sells his products to various clothing factories and tailoring shops. As per the majority of the Lebanese guys, he helps his family with the household.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional textiles in order to increase his sales and his income. He has high hopes for the future of his business and looks forward to open his own clothing store.

loans.use: to purchase additional textiles

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther L. is 44 years old and married to Edgar, her business partner. They presently live in Caloocan City, Metro Manila. Esther runs her own plastic ware store. Each day she looks into the sales, observes which are the best-selling items and what are the best-selling techniques. She has been in this business for four years and every month she earns an estimated net income of 10,000 PHP.

To help expand her business, Esther is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more quantities of plastic ware to be included in her inventory of products. Esther mentions that this loan will enable her to earn and pay her weekly obligations responsibly.

Just like her fellow community partners, the rainy seasons hamper Esther's business productivity. Instead of having a considerable number of customers, she finds her store abandoned when it rains. However, she finds ways to deal with this challenge, because she always keeps in mind her responsibilities as a micro entrepreneur.  She continually strives to become more profitable.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meetings where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase accessories, plastic ware, kitchen ware, and other household cleaning items to sell

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 30-year-old housewife, married to Sami, 35 years old. She has four children. Sanaa has always wanted to do something to support her husband, but since she wants to dedicate all of her time to raising their kids, she decided to open a barber shop for him since he has previous experience in the field.

Sanaa and her husband Sami took their first loan two years ago to open a barber shop and they have successfully managed it and gained a wide base of customers. Sanaa’s husband appears in the photograph, since she preferred not to have her picture published online.

Now Sanaa is applying for another loan in order to expand their barber shop by adding one more seat and  buying a steam machine to be able to serve more clients in their area.

loans.use: To add one more seat and  buy a steam machine for their barber shop.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 38-year-old man, married and father of three, working in construction. He lives in Beirut and has six years of experience. He makes aluminum frames (for windows and doors) and kitchen cabinets. He is committed to his business and considered an expert in his field. His clients can be anyone in need of such a service. He reports that he has not faced any obstacles because his experience and hard work helped him a lot.

He is requesting his first loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary tools such as a special gun to open holes as well as to fix the bathroom in his own house. In the future, he hopes to open a new branch of his business.

loans.use: To buy necessary tools and fix the bathroom in his own house.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 46 years old, married and has three children. She has been practicing mixed farming for over five years. She also runs a green grocery for extra income. She used to grow coffee to earn a living.

Hannah has been an active member of Faulu Kenya as a member of a group. Through the group she previously took out a loan from Faulu Kenya, which she used to boost her business. She has now requested a loan of 80,000 KES to buy a dairy cow, chaff cutter and animal feed.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow, chaff cutter and animal feed

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 29 years old, single and a very hardworking, gentle man. Jean has a shop in which he sells rice, salt and maize flour. He has been in business for two years, and his shop has enabled him to meet his needs.

Jean is requesting a loan to buy rice, salt and maize flour in order to increase his profits. In the future he plans to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy rice, salt and maize flour

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia S. has owned and rented out houses for the past ten years. She lives in her own house which has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Afia decided to join Yehu to access their loans in order to boost her business. With a 20,000 KES loan she wants to purchase cement and sand to build more rentals. With increased income, Afia dreams of establishing yet more rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase cement and sand to build more rentals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Tasali

texts.en:
Tasali is a 43-year-old woman, divorced and mother of two, working in a beauty institute. She lives in Beirut and specializes in facial treatments, tattoos, make-up and massages. Her customers consider her an honest woman providing good services, as she has considerable experience in the field. She has certificates from Canada but encountered financial problems when she opened her business. 

She is working hard to provide her children with the best education and a secure living and hopes to continue offering them the best living conditions possible. In the future she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy a machine to clean facial skin.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is 44 years old, married and lives with her family in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She makes a living as a farmer, growing mostly rice and corn which she sells in a local market. She has applied for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies. Her goal is to expand the size of her harvest.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is 49 years old and a member of the Royal Success loan group, which is affiliated with Faulu Kenya. For the last 10 years, she has earned a living as a farmer. Before that she worked as a salesperson and a laborer in a hotel. Because she is widowed and has eight children, she has no choice but to work very hard. She plans to increase her income by becoming a poultry farmer, and has applied for a loan for 10,000 Kes to buy chicks to raise.

loans.use: To start a poultry business by buying and raising chicks

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha S. is married but has no children. She lives in a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, Aisha has operated a food stall from her home. She sells her goods to neighbors and passersby. Aisha’s major challenge is seasonality in her business.

With a loan of 20,000 KES she wants to purchase cooking oil, potatoes and sacks of charcoal to sell. Aisha dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, potatoes and sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Nahason

texts.en:
Nahason is married with seven children, all adults save for the last born who is still in school. He does mixed farming in Kisii Town in South Rift, Kenya. He has been in farming for thirty-five years, producing maize, millet and tea and sells to Kenya Tea Development Authority. His family fully depends on farming. 

Nahason has made a request for a loan amounting to 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says additional income will improve his family's standard of living and help the last born complete his education. He will be glad to have another asset in the form of a dairy cow. He is focusing on clearing this first loan so as to request a second one.

Nahason complains about the low prices of produce yet says inputs are quite expensive.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Safeyya

texts.en:
Safeyya is a 47-year-old mother of three daughters and four sons. Safeyya and her husband have a grocery store in Deir al Balah in Gaza Strip.

Safeyya and her husband wanted to increase the profit and number of customers to ensure a better income for a big family, so Safeyya took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a larger variety of goods which will attract more customers.

Safeyya's husband is photographed instead of her because she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: to improve the store by increasing the variety of goods

loans.name: Balyewunya Mixed Group

texts.en:
Sarah N. is 45 years old, a single mother of four and runs a pub located in the Takajjunge trading center. She sells a variety of highly popular hard and soft liquor beverages which brings in weekly profits of 80,000 UGX. Sarah also supplements her earnings by selling bread.

Sarah has been affiliated with the Balyewunya Mixed Group, Mukono, for the last eight years. With this loan she is going to purchase more crates of both hard and soft beverages to resell.

In this group photo, one lady by the name of Harriet N. is not seen clearly, as her face is obscured behind another client wearing a red gomesi, or dress. She is identified as missing, in addition to other members who were not there when the photo was taken.

loans.use: To purchase both hard and soft beverages to resell

loans.name: Ledegonde

texts.en:
Ledegonde is 24 years old, married and has one child who is one year and one month old. Her husband and she own a shop in which they sell many items that are commonly used at home such as sugar, salt and maize flour.

Ledegonde is requesting a loan to buy sugar, salt and maize. With her earnings she plans to buy more sugar, salt and maize in order to increase her capital and make more in profits.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt and maize to sell

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Badenya sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 35 ans et 5 enfants par femme. Elles habitent le village de Zambougou, dans la commune rurale de Sanando, région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage et de parenté. Les membres du groupe font le commerce de poissons séchés, de tomates fraîches, d’habits, de la friperie et de la bouillie. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce les membres du groupe ont adhéré à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
 Madame Sagnini  Traoré a une grande réputation dans le village de Zambougou pour sa vente de bouillie et elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 4 sacs de grains de mil en gros dans la foire de Konodimini. 
Pour faire de la bouillie, on décortique les grains,  les débarrasse du son, les laves, les broie au moulin pour avoir de la semoule qui est ensuite préparée au feu pour obtenir de la bouillie. A la différence des autres vendeuses de bouillie, elle l’agrémente avec du lait caillé et du sucre.  
La vente se fait au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et en ambulant dans le village à une clientèle composée de femmes, d’hommes et d’enfants. 
Madame Sagnini  Traoré espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les petits besoins du foyer. Madame Sagnini  Traoré a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The seven women of the Badenya group are mostly married and live in monogamous families. They are 35 years old on average and have five children each.  They live in the village of Zambougou, in the rural municipality of Sanando, in the Ségou region (fourth largest administrative region of Mali) and met through family and friends. The group's members sell dried fish, fresh tomatoes, garments, second hand clothes, and gruel. The women joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance association with the aim of boosting their business capital, and are now on their third loan. Madam Sagnini Traoré has built a reputation in the Zambougou village for selling gruel, and aims to use her loan to purchase four bags of millet wholesale at the Konodimini market. 
To make gruel, she must first husk the seeds, wash them, crush them with a mill until they form semolina which she then heats to make gruel. She differentiates herself from other gruel vendors by adding curdled milk and sugar. She takes cash and credit sales from home or via door-to-door sales around the village. Her customer base is made up of men, women and children. Madam Sagnini Traoré aims to use the loan to generate an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA which will be used to reinvest in the business and to see to her family's needs. She would like to boost the scale of her business through her work with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: To purchase millet

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 37-year-old man, married and father of three, owner of a grocery and toy store. He lives in Beirut and opened his business in 2005. He had financial problems in the beginning but his previous loans helped him solve them. Mahmoud loves his job and treats his clients, who are essentially friends and neighbors, well.

This is his fourth loan cycle. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to buy more products and toys for his store. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more general products and toys for his store.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 46 years old, married and has four children. Her oldest child is 28 years old and her youngest is 10. She makes a living as a farmer in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur, where she has grown rice for the last 30 years. She is applying for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies. Her goal is to increase the size of her harvest.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ben Group

texts.fr:
Mariées toutes dans des familles monogames, les quatre femmes du groupe Ben ont une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 5 enfants et habitent le village de Zambougou, dans la commune rurale de Sanando relevant de la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage et de parenté. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’ustensiles plastiques, de tomates fraîches et de pagnes brodés. 
Dans le but d’avoir un fonds de commerce pour mieux mener leurs activités génératrices de revenus, les membres du groupe ont intégré l’institution de microfinance  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles  sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Bintou  D. est une vendeuse de pagnes brodés dans le village. Avec une très grande réputation dans son activité surtout du côté des jeunes fiancées, elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 pièces de pagnes wax au grand marché de Ségou.  La vente se fait au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et en ambulant dans les villages voisins à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
Madame Bintou  D. espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour subvenir aux petits besoins du foyer et  pour l’épargne.
texts.en:
All married in monogamous families, the four women of the group Ben have an average age of 38, 5 children and live in the village of Zambougou, in the rural commune of Sanando in the region of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali). They met each other through friend and family networks.

The members of the group do small trade selling plastic utensils, fresh tomatoes and embroidered pagnes. In order to acquire the funds to better drive their income generating activities, the members of the group approached the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and took out their first collective loan. 

Madame Bintou D. sells embroidered pagnes in the village. With a very big reputation, especially among young fiancees, she intends to use the loan to buy 2 pieces of cloth at the main market of Segou. Sales are made in cash and credit, and she sells both from home and in neighbouring villages to a predominantly female clientele.

With this loan, Madame Bintou D. hopes to make a monthly profit of 15000 FCFA which she will use to pay for basic needs at home and put aside in savings.

loans.use: Pour  acheter des pagnes brodés

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly is a married and has six children, two of whom are in college while the other six are grown and married. She lives in a house she rents that has both electricity and piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing and electricity. For the last decade, she has made a living selling clothes,  shoes and bags. Her main challenges are transportation and competition from other clothing sellers. She has applied for a loan of Kshs 70,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She became a member of Yehu to expand her business by securing loans such as this.

loans.use: To buy shoes, bags and clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun S. has been in the farming business for a long time in Prey Chhor commune, in the province of Kompong Cham. She and her husband always use their own farmland in planting rice crops only and earn a profit of approximately 7 USD per day to support the entire family. The couple is blessed with  seven single children, two of whom are able to make an income by cutting down villagers' banana trees when they are mature and no longer produce. The other five are still studying in the local school. 

In order to improve their standard of living, this family has decided to ask for their first loan from Kiva to rent their neighbor's farm so as to expand their crop-growing business, to hire a few domestic laborers for plowing the farmland, and to buy a few sacks of fertilizer for her crop.

loans.use: To rent their neighbor's farm,  hire a few domestic laborers for plowing, and to buy a few sacks of fertilizer for her crop.

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Sabali sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygames avec en moyenne 42 ans et 5 enfants par femme. Elles habitent le village de Zambougou, dans la commune rurale de Sanando, région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage, de voisinage et de parenté. Les membres du groupe font le commerce de pagnes brodés, d’ustensiles en plastiques (seaux d’eau, bols etc.), de condiments (tels la pâte d’arachide, la tomate fraîche) etc. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce et de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 5ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
 Madame Mâh T., qui est la présidente du groupe, est connue dans le village pour sa vente de pâte d’arachide. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 sacs de grains d’arachide en gros dans la foire de Konodimini. 
Pour faire de la pâte d’arachide, on débarrasse les grains des impuretés par triage manuel, on grille ensuite les grains à l’aide d’une barrique conçue pour la circonstance puis on les décortique pour l’enlever des coques fines et enfin on les broie au moulin pour avoir de la pâte prête à la consommation. La vente se fait au comptant et à crédit, à domicile, sur commande et au petit marché du village à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Madame Mâh T. espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les petits besoins du foyer. A l’image des autres femmes du groupe, elle a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en: The six women of the group Sabali are married for the most part in polygamous families and average 42 years of age and five children each. The women live in the village of Zambougou, in the rural commune of Sanando, Region of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of marriage, community, and kinship. The group members do commerce in embroidered pagne cloth, plastic utensils (buckets, bowls, etc.), and condiments (such as peanut butter, fresh tomatoes, etc.) With the goal of increasing their business capital and building up their inventories, the group members decided to collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. And they are now on their fifth solidarity loan cycle. Ms. Mâh T., who is the president of the group, is known in the village for selling peanut butter. She intends to use her loan to buy 3 sacks of peanuts wholesale at the Konodimini fair. To make peanut butter, the peanuts are sorted by hand to remove impurities, and then they are roasted using a cask designed for the circumstances. Next, they are skinned. Finally, the peanuts are crushed in a mill to obtain the peanut paste ready for consumption. Sales are made by cash or credit at the house, by special order, and at the small village market. The customer base is composed of women and men. With this loan, Ms. Mâh T. hopes to make an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in the business and meeting sundry needs at home. Just like the other women of the group, she has the goal of increasing her business volume through the partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy peanuts (to process into peanut butter)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional products.

loans.name: Vegelyn

texts.en: Vegelyn is 40 years old, married and has three children. Her oldest child is 15 and her youngest is 11. She and her husband make a living by growing rice and corn. She also runs a sari-sari (or variety) store on the side, where she sells items such canned goods, noodles and coffee. She plans to use this loan to buy corn and rice seeds as well as fertilizer for her farm.

loans.use: to buy corn and rice seeds as well as fertilizer.

loans.name: Mhamad

texts.en:
Mhamad is a 33-year-old man, married with no children, working as a car painter. He lives in Beirut and works in his shop. His father opened the shop in 1970 and Mhamad has worked there since 1990. He provides good quality work and his clients are mainly friends and neighbors.

This is Mhamad's seventh loan cycle. He reports that the previous loans helped him fulfill the needs of the shop. He is now requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy extra paint, tools and gas for his store. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more tools, gas and paint.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en: Annabelle is 41 years old, married and has three children who range in age from 15 to 10. For the last three years, she has made a living as a rice farmer in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She sells her rice in local markets and works very hard to support her family. Her goal in life is to make sure that her children finish college and have bright futures. She has applied for a loan to buy fertilizer and fuel for her tractor.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and gasoline.

loans.name: Zulekha

texts.en:
Zulekha is a widow with six children, five of whom are employed, while one still attends school. They all live in the house she owns which has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and electricity fees.

For over ten years, she has operated real estate houses, with neighbours and passersby as her potential customers. Zulekha faces the major challenge of competition from other real estate houses in her area of operation. She dreams of building two more houses in the future. With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to pay her daughter's school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en:
Donatha is 43 years old, married and has two children, 22 and 14 years old. Her husband is a farmer.

Donatha owns a bar in which she sells different types of beer. She has been in business for three years, and it has helped her meet the needs of her family easily without any other support.

Donatha is requesting a loan to buy more beer to increase her profits.

loans.use: To purchase more beer to sell

loans.name: Khaetullo

texts.en:
Khaetullo G. is an entrepreneurial young man who is engaged in cattle breeding. He is a responsible person and a grateful son, who lives with his parents and supports them, according to Kyrgyz tradition. He started his business using initial capital of 10,000 soms (KGS) for purchasing cattle and manages to earn about 9,000 KGS in a month. With hard work and great effort, Khaetullo has multiplied the number of milch cows and with the revenue, he was able to buy a car for his family. 
 
Khaetullo has applied for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy more milch cows, which will allow him raise his milk sales. He is eager to broaden his business because he plans to have a baby. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target an especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Jelita

texts.en:
Jelita S. is 53 years old, married and has eight children. She farms rice and raises hogs. Her husband, who is also a farmer, mainly manages their farm. She also helps him plant the rice while managing their small backyard piggery. She makes sure the pigs are healthy.

Jelita's loan will be used to purchase pig feed, fertilizer and other farming necessities. She hopes her family's living conditions will improve.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed, fertilizer and other farming necessities

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou P. is 34 years old, married and has four children, the oldest being fourteen years old while the youngest is only two.

Marilou is a farmer. She primarily grows rice, then sells her harvest to the market. Marilou works hard to sustain her family especially so as to support her children's education.

Marilou's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farming necessities.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farming necessities

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario, a hard-working 48-year-old father of six children, is married and lives in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur with his family. His oldest child is 16 years old and the youngest is 6.

Mario is a farmer and primarily grows rice crops which he and his wife sell to the market. Mario, who works hard to provide for his family and dreams that his children will finish college and have bright futures, will use the loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Teola

texts.en:
Teola R. is from the village of Villaramos. She is 45 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children.

Teola owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Teola joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to do business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC.

Teola is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase fresh fish to sell; some will also be used to purchase groceries for her sari-sari store. This loan will be her sixth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish for sale and groceries for sari-sari store

loans.name: Elinestine

texts.en:
Elinestine is a mother of one child who is one year and eight months old. She is 27 years old and her husband is a businessman. 

She sells sorghum and beans; she has sold sorghum for 3 years which has enabled her to renovate her house. She hopes to expand her shop with the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy sorghum and beans

loans.name: Kol

texts.en:
Kol K. is able to make a living by selling a few fresh fish on her wooden kiosk in front of her house in the Ornlong Veng district in Siem Reap. She always goes to the place which is full of fisherman in order to buy fish in bulk for a reasonable price, and then she sells them retail for net income. On average, Kol K. generates from her fish-selling business around $3.80 a day to help cover the family's living expenses. She has a life partner in her husband who is a motorcycle repairman, earning around $4 in profit per day in order to share responsibility with Kol K.. 

 Kol K. will use the loan to buy many sacks of cashews to stock up for resale. This loan will really help her and her family with extra income.

loans.use: to buy many sacks of cashews to stock up for resale.

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette S. is a member in good standing of Paglaum MPC, a Kiva partner. She is from Langatian Roxas, 22 years old, married, and has to infant child. Janette operates a business in agriculture sector primarily raising pigs in her backyard.

In 2008, she joined PMPC. Janette successfully paid her previous loan of 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which was used to buy materials for the construction of additional pig fencing. She is now requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, this will be used to buy three piglets worth 1,500 PHP each as well as pig feed. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Janette from PMPC.

loans.use: to buy three piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Soro

texts.en:
A. Soro is married and her husband is Ahrorov Olimjon. She has two sons and a daughter. Soro is a very hardworking woman who trades in the «Korvon» market. She started her business with her own capital. She sells children's clothes. She has been in this business for 12 years. Soro wants to expand his business and get more profits for her families needs. Soro would like to get a loan of $2500 US for purchasing new seasonal children's clothes. She thanks all lenders who support her in realizing her desire. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy seasonal children's clothes

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 25 years old and is a married woman with a 4-year-old child. Her husband works as a tricycle driver and a farmer.

Arlyn is in the hog-raising business. She has a small backyard piggery that she hopes to grow. She fattens the pigs and sells them to the market. Arlyn also helps her husband at the farm. They also own a small banana farm.

Arlyn's loan will be used to purchase seed and fertilizer. She hopes for her businesses to grow.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance is 52 years old. She has 6 children who are between the ages 12 to 30 years old. She has a store in which she sells cooking oil, rice, and salt. She has done this business for one year and it has enabled her to develop herself and meet her needs. She is requesting a loan to buy cooking oil, rice and salt to fill her store and make more profits.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, rice, and salt.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer is 29 years old and is a married woman with 4 children. Her oldest child is 11 years old while the youngest is 5. Elmer and her husband are both farmers. Together, they till their land and prepare it well for planting. They have been growing rice for 10 years.

Elmer's loan will be used to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs.

In the future, Elmer hopes to have a stable business. She also dreams for her children to be successful in their chosen fields.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Kadyrzhan

texts.ru:
Кадыржану Омуралиеву 52 года, женат и является отцом шести дочерей.
Кадыржан родился в простой и многодетной семье фермера и с детства помогал отцу по хозяйству. После окончания школы, Кадыржан поступил на учебу в автошколу  и устроился в родном колхозе на работу в качестве водителя грузовых автомашин. В 1985 году в возрасте 26 лет Кадыржан женился и спустя два года у него родилась дочь. В этом же году колхоз, в котором он работал, выделил ему небольшой участок в родном селе, где он построил дом и сараи, и стал содержать небольшое хозяйство. С годами семья Кадыржана росла, и росли потребности - зарплаты шофера не хватало, и Кадыржан решил полностью посвятить свое время разведению скота. В 2010 году Кадыржан выдал старшую дочку замуж и для того, чтобы по всем обычаям, включая подготовку хорошего приданного, провести свадьбу, ему пришлось продать две дойных коровы и одного бычка. На данный момент, в хозяйстве у Кадыржана осталась лишь одна дойная корова, и поэтому он обратился за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы, овец и бычков. В планах у Кадыржана - расширение площади сарая и увеличение поголовья скота.
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Kadyrzhan O. is 52 years old, married, and is the father of six daughters.

Kadyrzhan was born into a large, simple farm family, and since childhood he helped his father on the farm.  After leaving school, Kadyrzhan went to driving school and got a job at his home collective farm driving cargo. In 1985 when he was 26 years old, Kadyrzhan married, and two years later his daughter was born. That same year the collective farm where he worked allocated to him a small plot of land in his home village where he constructed a house and sheds, and began a small farm. Over time, Kadyrzhan’s family grew, as did their expenses.  His salary as a driver was no longer enough.  Kadyrzhan decided to devote all of his time to raising cattle.  In 2010 Kadyrzhan married off his eldest daughter, and to pay for a traditional wedding, he had to sell two milk cows and one calf. Now on his farm, Kadyrzhan has only one milk cow.  Consequently he is asking for a loan for 100,000 som (KGS) to buy a milk cow, sheep, and calves. Kadyrzhan plans to expand his barn and increase his livestock.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Lak

texts.en:
Lak S. is a 52-year-old married woman and mother who has been living in the province of Kompong Tom. Lak S. and her husband have spent most of their lifetime with growing rice and cashews on their existing farmland. They have seven children; two are married and have started to live in their own houses, while the rest are single and of one them is employed as a worker in the garment industry. 

Lak S. is concerned because she has one child who is going to marry soon, but her personal savings are not enough to hold the wedding party for her child. In order to deal with this problem, Lak S. would like to request some funds as a Kiva loan for assisting her child to prepare the wedding ceremony which is coming up in a short time.

loans.use: To hold a wedding party for her child.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is married with three children, two boys and one girl. Her husband is employed and he contributes to the family's basic needs. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. For the past two years, she has operated a clothes-selling business. She sells in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. Salma faces a major challenge in the seasonality of her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 35 years old, married and has three children. Her oldest child is 10 years old and the youngest is 7.

Maribel is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She has been growing rice for 10 years. Maribel usually earns about 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from this farming. She works hard to improve her earnings and be able to sustain her children's education.

Maribel's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
Moustafa is a 25-year-old single man and works in a cellular shop. He lives in Beirut. He is very attentive to his customers and is en expert in his domain. 

This is his fourth loan and he reports that the previous loans allowed him to improve his financial and social situation. He requests a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy more recharge cards and mobile phones. In the future, he wishes to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy recharge cards and mobile phones.

loans.name: Mamurjon

texts.en:
Mamurjon lives in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He is married and has one child. He is a hardworking man and is engaged in selling fabrics. He has been in this business for nine years. Mamurjon purchases goods from Dubai and sells them in Dushanbe in his shop in the market of «Korvon».  His average income is 400 Somoni per a day.  

Marmurjon wants to expand his business.  That’s why he wishes to increase the assortment of his goods.  Mamurjon would like to get a loan of US$1100 to purchase new and good quality materials, which will attract more customers.

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: buy new fabrics for his shop

loans.name: Pang

texts.en:
Pang S., age 31, lives in Siem Reap Province. Previously, she used to work in a local restaurant as a cook and she also spent the rest of her time selling soft drinks like Coke, pure drinking water, and fruit juice to the villagers. She is married to Soun Vibol, age 30, who shares the responsibility with Pang S. in the family by driving a motor taxi.

 He runs his business very well because he has skills in communication which he uses with his customers. However, his income is not so much due to his motorcycle being too small to carry many passengers. That is why Pang S. has decided to ask for a loan of $300 to buy a trailer to connect to the existing motorcycle so that her husband can use it to pick up more passengers than before.

loans.use: To buy a trailer to connect to their existing motorcycle.

loans.name: Letitia

texts.en: Letitia is 22 years old.   She has one child who is 6 months old.  She is married to a businessman.  Leatitia owns a store in which she sells sugar and rice.  She has done this for 4 years.   She finds this business very useful to her because it enables her to provide for her family and meet their needs.  With the profits from her business, she hopes to renovate her house.

loans.use: buy sugar and rice to sell

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is 37 years old, married, and has 4 children. Her oldest child is 15 years old and the youngest is 4. 

Anabelle is a farmer working in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She has been growing rice for 5 years. Anabelle works hard to keep her farm productive. She also hopes to open another business.

Anabelle's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more products for the store.

loans.name: Sairanbi

texts.en:
K. Sairanbi lives in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. She is widow and has two clever daughters, one of them works at home taking care of her family. Sairanbi sells woman’s shoes in the market of Pandjer in Dushanbe region. She started her business with her own capital and has been in this business for 7 years.  

Sairanbi would like to get a loan of 11500 Somoni to stock up on new fashionable shoes and expand her business.  She thanks all lenders who support her and her family, which allows her and her family to live better.

loans.use: to stock new shoes for her store

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a 27-year-old mother to 4 children. She is married and lives in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur with her family. Her oldest child is 8 years old.

Daisy is a farmer. She primarily grows rice crops and sells her harvest to the market. With 4 kids, Daisy finds it a challenge to make ends meet. She decided to open a sari-sari store to help in their daily needs. Daisy hopes for her farm and store to grow.

Daisy's loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and store items to sell such as canned goods.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and store items to sell such as canned goods

loans.name: Tharcis

texts.en: Tharcis is 32 years old.  She has 4 children who are between the ages of 3 and 12.  Her husband sells goat meat and Tharcis sells goat hides.   She has been in this business for 7 years.   Tharcis is requesting a loan to buy more hides to make more profits.  With the profits, she plans to renovate her house.

loans.use: buy goat hides to sell

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
Rustam is married and is a father of three children.  He is the only income earner for his family.   His wife is not working and is bringing up their children at home.  Rustam is engaged in animal husbandry. He has been in this business for 5 years. He purchases cattle and feeds them for a certain period of time, then sells them in the markets of Yavan, Sultonobod and Rudaki.   Rustam would like to get a loan of US$1000 to purchase more cattle, which will allow him to expand this business.

loans.use: buy more cattle for his business

loans.name: Edwelyn

texts.en:
48-year-old Edwelyn is a married woman with 3 children. Her oldest child is 18 years old and the youngest is 14. 

Edwelyn is a farmer working in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She has been growing rice for 5 years. Edwelyn earns income from this farming. She works hard to improve her harvest and earnings. She wants to be able to sustain her children's education.

Edwelyn's loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her rice farm

loans.name: Alijon

texts.en:
Alijon lives in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He is a single man. Alijon has a business selling building materials and household goods in the market of «Sultoni Kobir». He has been in this business for 7 years. He buys goods from wholesale supplier and sells them at the market. His average income is 300 Somoni per a day. He purchases the goods from wholesaler for between 1000 and 5000 Somoni. 

Alijon would like to get a loan of  US$1100 to purchase building materials and household goods to sell. He thanks all lenders who support him, which allows him to expand his business and improve his family’s life.

loans.use: To buy building materials and household goods to sell

loans.name: Talantbek

texts.en:
Talantbek M. is 38, married, and has three sons. He started his cattle-breeding business in 2005 with an initial capital of 4,000 KGS, which was used for purchasing one calf. Today he has a small farm with two milch cows. With the revenues from selling milk and meat products, he was able to buy a car. Talantbek has broadened his activities by providing transportation services, which bring in additional earnings for the family.
 
Talantbek has applied for a loan of 130,000 KGS to purchase three milch cows and forage for his cattle. With the revenues, he plans to reconstruct his barn and increase the number of cattle. 

Bai Tushum & Partners uses Kiva funding to target especially vulnerable populations. Bai Tushum & Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 30 years old.  She has 4 children who are between 4 and 10 years old.  Her husband is a business man.  Claudine sells sorghum and beans and has been in this business for two years.  Her business has enabled her to feed her family and pay her children's school fees.  Claudine is requesting a loan to buy beans and sorghum in order to make more profits.  With the profits she hopes to make, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more sorghum and beans to resell

loans.name: Good Samaritan Group-Mukono

texts.en: 37-year-old Alice N. is one lady who exudes confidence and a sense of purpose. These attributes have been her business stocks in trade over the course of the last 4 years as she goes about her business rounds, which are tailoring and bricks sales. These businesses are situated in Kitale-Mukono. Before this happily married mother of 5  ventured into any of the above businesses, she was doing mostly agriculture. Weekly, she says her tailoring business generates 200,000 shillings in profit. With this loan, Alice says she is going to purchase more cloth-making textile to make more clothes and also more bricks to resell. Alice belongs to Good Samaritan group.

loans.use: To purchase cloth to make clothes and bricks to resell

loans.name: Safo

texts.en:
O. Safo lives in Dushanbe. He is married and is a father of four children. Safo is the only income earner for this family, his wife is a homemaker.  From childhood Safo has been interested in agriculture, that’s why today he engaged in animal husbandry.  He has been in this business for more than 5 years. He purchases young cattle from the market, fattens them, and resells them at a reasonable price which gives him a profit. Safo would like to get a loan of 5000 Somoni to purchase more young cattle to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 31 years old and is a married woman. She has 3 children aged 16, 10 and 5. Her husband works as a driver.

Gemma is a farmer working in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She has been growing rice for 8 years. She works hard to support her family. 

Gemma's loan will be used to purchase farm fertilizers and other supplies. She hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other supplies for her rice farm

loans.name: Alexis

texts.en: Alexis is 29 years old.  He is very hardworking.  He owns a general store in which he sells a variety of items such as radio batteries, rice, sugar, and clothes. Alex is requesting a loan to buy more batteries, rice and sugar in order to increase his inventory.

loans.use: purchase batteries, sugar, and rice to resell

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
