31-year-old Jenalyn is a married woman. She has 2 children aged 16 and 13. Her husband works as a driver and farmer.

Jenalyn is engaged in farming. She grows rice crops then sells her harvest at the market. Aside from farming, Jenalyn also owns and manages a sari-sari store, selling items such as canned goods.

Jenalyn's loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and additional merchandise to resell.

loans.use: to purchase seeds/fertilizers for her rice farm and merchandise for her store

loans.name: Junelyn

texts.en:
Junelyn is a mother to 2 young children ages 4 and 9 months. She is 22 years old and married. Junelyn is engaged in farming. She helps her husband, who is a farmer, maintain their rice farm. She helps in keeping the farm free of weeds and pests. Junelyn does her best to help provide for her family. She also takes good care of her children.

Junelyn's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes for their harvest to increase.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Melecia

texts.en:
Melecia is a 59-year-old married woman with 9 children. Her oldest child is 39 years old. Melecia is a farmer and tills land in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She prepares her land well for crops. She grows rice then sells her harvest to the market. Melecia works hard for her family.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a 48-year-old married woman with 7 children. Her oldest child is 20 years old. She is engaged in farming and primarily grows rice crops. Rosie does her best to keep the farm productive. She sells her harvest to the market.

Rosie's loan will be used to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers. She hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is a 39-year-old married woman with 5 children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the textile business for 10 years. Her hardships are limited capital and price fluctuations. Her vision is running a wholesale business, educating her family, building a house, and owning motorcycles. Shamim intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is a mother to 7 children. She is 41 years old and married. Her oldest child is 18 years old.

Shirley is a farmer working in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She grows rice that she sells to the market. Shirley also makes chorizo that she sells to the people in her community. Shirley works hard to make ends meet.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Weraga Group-Mukono

texts.en:
Thirty-year-old Paul M. has been overseeing his motorcycle transportation business for 6 years now in the busy and boisterous Seeta neighborhood of Mukono. This place, like many other sprouting urban areas in Uganda, has taken to the motorcycle craze with gusto. Needless to say, many people in Uganda today prefer using motorcycle transport because it gets them through the taxi grid locks quicker. In this kind of business, as Paul has learned, a lot of good human relationship skills, patience and tenacity are required. It is a highly competitive business that requires a lot of determination. Paul also has a rentals business that he values highly as it brings in additional profit. He says his profits amount to 200,000 UGX weekly, and he says using proceeds from this loan, he is going to revamp and refurbish his rental houses.

About his marital status, Paul is married with 4 lively kids who all go to school.

loans.use: to refurbish rental houses

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a 26-year-old, hardworking woman who lives in a rented house in Hoima, Uganda. She is a banking officer and earns a salary from her job. She has not faced any challenges at her work place. Her dream is to educate her siblings and to develop her career. Ruth needs this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 39 years old and is married with 7 children. Her oldest child is 17 years old.

Vilma is a farmer in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She grows rice at her farm, which she then sells to the market. Vilma also owns and manages a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items like soap and shampoo.

Vilma's loan will be used for her farm. She will purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes that this loan will help increase her harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Saiyohat

texts.en:
Saiyohat is married with four children. She has a small kiosk at the market in Istaravshan and sells fabrics used to make women’s national dresses. Saiyohat has been in this business for 22 years. She is very nice to customers and treats them well. Her clients enjoy buying things from her and come back often. Saiyohat's business has become a stable source of income for her family. Saiyohat would like to get a loan of 3,000 USD to increase the assortment of goods she sells. She would spend the additional income to improve her family's living conditions.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase fabrics

loans.name: Belina

texts.en: Belina M. is 59 years old, widowed, and has four adult children.  She lives in Khashtarak village in the area of Ijevan.  Since 1988 Belina has worked at a mineral water factory. She also runs a farm. Her son and her grandchildren help her in this hard work raising cows, pigs, and chickens and growing fruits and vegetables in the garden. With income from farming, Belina and her son meet their family's needs and pay for Belina’s grandchild's education.  She is requesting a loan for 800,000 AMD, which she will use to buy raspberry seedlings and fertilizer and to put up a fence around the seedlings. This is Belina's third loan from Nor Horizon and she has always repaid on time.

loans.use: To purchase raspberry seedlings and fertilize and to put up a fence around the seedlings

loans.name: Syuzanna

texts.en: Syuzanna O. is 36 years old. She lives in Vanadzor city with her two daughters, who are students. For over five years Syuzanna has been running her own business: clothing sales in a rented shop. She sells women’s, men’s and children’s clothes, which she buys weekly from Yerevan. Thanks to her business income Syuzanna keeps her family and pays for her children's educations. Syuzanna has already received loans from Nor Horizon six times. Now she is seeking for a 250,000 AMD loan to buy spring season clothes to resell.

loans.use: To buy spring season clothes to resell

loans.name: Ma. Gelinda

texts.en:
Ma. Gelinda is engaged in a fishing business. Her husband is a fisherman and Ma. Gelinda sells all his catch to the market. She has requested a loan of 7000 PHP to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other supplies. She believes this will help her husband catch more fish. Ma. Gelinda works hard to improve their business and earnings.

Ma. Gelinda is 35 years old and has children.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other supplies

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 41 years old and married, with 6 children. Her husband is a fisherman. Marites sells all his catch to the market. She also makes and sells dried fish.

Marites has requested a loan to purchase a pump boat. She hopes that her family's business will grow.

loans.use: to purchase a pump boat

loans.name: Zafarjo

texts.en:
M. Zafarjon is 37 years old. He is married and has 3 children. Zafarjon is the sole breadwinner and his only income comes from the cultivation and sale of large livestock at the local market. Every year, he buys young heifers from the farms in adjacent villages. He raises them with the help of his wife and children and then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers.  Zafarjon would like to expand his business, as the income from his existing herd isn't enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase additional young cattle. To do this, he needs to invest an additional $1000 USD in his business. Zafarjon has applied for a loan for this amount from Kiva's partner organization, IMON International.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase cattle to expand the business and improve his family's living conditions

loans.name: Wesly

texts.en:
Wesly is a 27-year-old married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 9 years old and the youngest is 1.

Wesly is engaged in a fishing business. Her husband is a fisherman. Wesly is the one who sells his catch to the market. Wesly works hard to earn more. She wants to be able to send all her children to school. She hopes for them to have bright futures.

Wesly's loan will be used to purchase fish nets, hooks and other materials. This loan will help Wesly improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish nets, hooks and other materials

loans.name: Ikrom

texts.en:
Ikrom has a successful small business selling spare parts for cars. From his little kiosk, Ikrom sells an assortment of good quality items. His business, which he has operated for about six years, provides the main source of income for him, his wife and their five children. In the future, Ikrom hopes to expand by opening a second sales location.

Ikrom has requested a loan of 10,000 TJS to add to his working capital and allow him to purchase more inventory. We are happy for this opportunity to provide the means for Ikrom to continue developing his business. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to increase the range of goods he sells

loans.name: Misuless

texts.en: Misuless is a thirty-four-year-old married woman with seven children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in firewood for the last three years, which she started with money saved from farming. Her hardship is transport problems because of poor roads. Her vision is to have a wholesale business, plus educating her children. Misuless needs the loan to buy more firewood for resale.

loans.use: to buy more firewood for resale

loans.name: Nemat

texts.en:
For the past ten years, Nemat has put much effort into his agricultural activities. He learned this humble work from his father. His father taught him everything about farming so that when he had his own family he could support his wife as well as his children. Now, Nemat is busy preparing his farm for their next planting. His wish is that he will again have an abundant harvest, says Nemat, the father of four children. 

He would like to ask for a loan of 6,000 TJS that will be used for purchasing fertilizers, herbicides and ammonium sulfate. Nemat is sure that the loan will help him improve his harvest, and he thanks everyone who supports him with this loan.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and ammonium sulfate

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 51 years old and is a married woman with eight children. Her oldest child is 36 years old and the youngest is 13.

Sonia has been engaged in fishing for two years. Her husband is a fisherman and is the one who catches fish. Sonia sells all his catch to the market. Sonia works hard to support her family.

This loan will be used to purchase fishing hooks and nets. This will help Sonia's husband catch more fish.

loans.use: to purchase fishing hooks and nets

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a fifty-three-year-old married man with six children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in electrical installation for ten years. He started the business immediately after school and he is happy to be his own employer. His hardship is limited funds. His vision is to have a  big business and to educate the children. Samuel needs the loan to buy electrical accessories such as flat iron, bulbs and wires.

loans.use: to buy electrical accessories such as bulbs, flat iron and wires.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en: Hanifa is a thirty-seven-year-old married woman with six children, and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in a hotel business for three years, which she started with the capital of 800,000 UGX and now she has 1,500,000 UGX as working capital. Her hardship is high labor turnover and her vision is running a big hotel and educating her children. Hanifa needs the credit facility to buy furniture and a television set.

loans.use: to buy furniture and television set

loans.name: Sahib

texts.en:
Sahib A. is 42 years old. He is married and has three children. He sells cattle. As a rule, Sahib purchases small cattle in the central market, feeds them and then resells them at higher prices in the local market. 

Being in this business since a young age, he knows very well how to choose the animals, how to breed them and look after them. Thus, he gets up every morning in order to feed the animals and to look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful and to generate a stable, considerable income for his large family. 

Owing to AqroInvest and KIVA, Sahib was able to purchase more cattle and improve his living conditions. He successfully finished paying off his loan and is now planning to purchase more cattle. For this purpose, he requests 2,000 AZN that he will spend for the purchase of young cattle and feed for them.

loans.use: to purchase five calves and feed for them

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married woman who lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is 55 years old and has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for ten years. She sells items like soft drinks and chips. She also sells rice and corn to the people in her community.

Maria is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy more items to sell, such as rice, corn and soft drinks. In the future, Maria hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, corn, soft drinks and other products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional ewes (baby sheep), raise them and make her specialty cheeses

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en: Nathan is a thirty-two-year-old married man with five children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has had a retail shop for two years which he started with one million UGX from the sale of pigs, and now his current working capital is 3,000,000 UGX. His hardship is the increase in commodity prices, and his vision is to have a wholesale business, educate his children and build a permanent house. Nathan needs the credit facility to buy sugar, eggs and paraffin for resale.

loans.use: to buy sugar, eggs and paraffin for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to upgrade her car garage tools and to purchase special equipment for oil changing and car service

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir A. is 30 years old and he works as a farmer. He is married and has two sons. His main business is farming and cattle breeding, which provide him with the means to meet the needs of his family. He is very experienced and has the special skills in livestock care that help him to develop his business. He raises and sells livestock and also sells meat and milk. 

Samir is requesting a loan of 2,000 AZN to enable him to purchase more cattle. The loan will greatly improve Samir’s income and his family's living standards.

loans.use: purchase five calves and fodder

loans.name: Assiatta Mawulé

texts.fr: Madame Assiata Mawulé est âgée de  58 ans. Elle réside à Avépozo et a en sa charge 02 enfants. Elle est spécialisée dans la vente des jus et l’eau mise en sachet.  Elle  a démarré son activité en 2005 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Ensuite elle revend à la devanture de sa maison. Elle sollicite ce premier prêt  pour  l’achat  de  5 paquets de sachets, 3 boîtes d’arome, 2 sacs de sucre et l’entretien des frigos  afin de maximiser son profit pour pouvoir prendre en charge la famille.
texts.en: Assiata Mawuli is 58 years old. She resides in Avépozo and she takes care of her two children. Her business is to sell take-away juices and water. She has been in this business since 2005 and she purchases her supplies at the main market in Lomé. She operates her business in front of her house. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of five packs of take-away bags, three boxes of syrup, two bags of sugar and for the maintenance of her refrigerators. Her intention is to maximize her profit in order to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase packages, sugar, syrups and to provide refrigerators maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 33-year-old married man living with his wife and two young children who are still attending school. He has been working as a plumber, installing toilets, faucets etc… since 1998. At the same time, he works as a home electrician, specialized in home electrical projects. He works on a freelance basis. He is the main income provider of his family. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase an air compressor and cutting machinery in order to better satisfy his customers' demands. He says that the loan will help him fulfill his business objectives. He is planning to enlarge his business operation and pursue more work and more projects.

loans.use: to purchase an air compressor and cutting machinery.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en: Augustine is a twenty-nine-year-old married man with three children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for three years and the proceeds have enabled him to support his family. His hardship is price fluctuation, and his vision is to have a big shop, educate his children and construct a residential house. Augustine intends to use the money to buy soap and bread for resale.

loans.use: to buy soap and bread for resale.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is 61 years old and is a married man with six children. He owns a canteen where he sells prepared meals. He cooks the food that he sells. He also grows pigs in his backyard. Ruben works hard to provide for his family.

Ruben has requested a loan to purchase pig feeds and ingredients like vegetables and spices. He hopes for his canteen and piggery to grow.

loans.use: to purchase pig feeds and ingredients like vegetables and spices

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala G. is 40 years old and comes from a large and humble family. She is single and lives with her family. Her father's hard and demanding character showed her the significant value of work from the time she was young, and therefore she has been successful in various activities throughout her life.

Now Kamala dedicates herself to raising and selling livestock, and with the income she generates, she provides a better quality of life for herself and her old parents, who have become her best friends.

Kamala is asking for a 2,000 AZN loan in order to buy more young livestock to raise and sell when they are fully grown. With this investment she will be able to substantially grow her earnings and improve her quality of life. Let’s support this dedicated woman's proposal.

loans.use: to purchase five young cattle

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.en:
Gulzar A. is a loving mother of four sons. She dedicated her life to her children and after they grew up, when the eldest son was 34, she decided to start her own business. Gulzar loved flowers from childhood and has a huge garden where she raises her flowers. She knows everything about flora, how to raise, how to water and other methods to keep her flowers blossoming. 

When she was left alone with her small pension, she started selling different flower roots to neighbors and relatives, and after time it became so popular that Gulzar started raising different sorts of flowers in her front room in separate pots. Now she is two years in this business and she is very happy that she can earn from what she enjoys.

Gulzar applied for a loan to purchase more seeds and flowerpots to raise her beautiful flowers, and she hopes she can increase her monthly turnover with this loan.

loans.use: purchase seeds and flowerpots

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional car oil and exhaust systems.

loans.name: Solmaz

texts.en:
Solmaz I. is 60  years old, married and has four children. 

She has worked at purchasing and reselling cattle with her husband since 2004. Solmaz is a hard-working woman who has fought to provide for her family and children normal life conditions. Today they are working adults, thanks to her example. 

She would like to request a loan of 2,000 AZN in order to purchase additional cattle to increase her inventory and to meet customer demands. Solmaz believes this will lead to greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her family. In the future, she would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into her business. Solmaz deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving her.

loans.use: to purchase four cattle and fodder

loans.name: Hiam

texts.en:
Hiam is a 33-year-old mother of five. She began a bridal salon from her home that has expanded so well she recently moved to a shop in her neighborhood. Hiam employs one woman and has gained a wonderful reputation in her village and surrounding area.

Hiam needs this loan to assist with expenses of moving to a shop outside her home. The funds are paying for additional dresses, decoration of the store and moving of her furniture and shelving.

Hiam wants to see her store continue to expand and eventually to hire more staff. She sees her business as creating a future without economic fear for her family.

loans.use: To cover costs associated with moving to a shop outside her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an ice cream machine and popcorn maker and to make small renovations for her store

loans.name: Darin

texts.en:
Darin is a young woman from village of Reineh in northern Israel. She holds a computer engineering degree. While Darin worked in her field she found it extremely difficult to find an adequate and worthy position in Reineh or surrounding area. She decided she did not want to leave her village, home and family to relocate for a position in central Israel. Reineh decided to utilize her degree on the side by giving private training courses and at the same time develop a steady income through opening a business. In 2008 she opened a shoe and gift shop. Over the last two years Darin decided to remodel her store and focus on gifts while expanding into scarves, accessories and religious clothing. These items have year-wide demand as opposed to seasonal.

Darin needed this loan to purchase stock and build new shelving for her store.

Over the next few years Darin wants to continue to expand her business, hire staff and bring in area clients who now purchase in stores outside of the village. She sees her business becoming the store of choice for women from her village and the surrounding area.

loans.use: to purchase stock and build new shelving for her store

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice Y. is a divorced woman with five children, three of whom attend school while two are at home. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees, clothing and food for the family. 

For the past four years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality and the high cost of transportation. During rainy season the demand for charcoal is lower compared to the dry summer season. 

She dreams of accessing bigger loans and purchasing a plot of land in the future.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Kaida

texts.en:
Kaida is a divorced mother of six who works from home as a seamstress. Her business is doing well enough that she employs another seamstress. They work from her home in the kitchen or salon. Kiada's services are in high demand and she has expanded and created a separate room for her business.

The loan is needed to organize the room, renovate and ensure an orderly and conducive work environment.

Kaida wants to continue expanding her business. Over the next few years she wants to hire additional staff, purchase needed equipment and continue to successfully manage her business, ensuring a strong future for her children.

loans.use: to organize her work room, renovate and ensure an orderly and conducive work environment.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 44-year-old married man. He is from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two children. He has owned butcher shop since 1995. He offers his clients tasty fresh meat. His work income is vital to be able to take good care of his family. He has obtained two Kiva loans and was a reliable client with payments on time.
 
Today, he is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a car for his job. In that way, it will be easier for him to buy meat from wholesalers located in different areas. He estimates that with the coming harvest, his profits will increase.

loans.use: to purchase a car for his job.

loans.name: Safar

texts.en:
Safar H. is a 33-year-old trader. He is married with two small children. He is a entrepreneur who sells various kinds of foodstuff, such as cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, and detergents, in his grocery store, which he built eight years ago. Currently Safar has about 500 AZN in inventory. His monthly net profit is about 300 AZN. 

Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN in order to increase his stock of goods. He promises to repay the loan within the expected term and expresses his gratitude to everyone supporting him.

loans.use: to purchase more items to increase monthly income

loans.name: Katikko Small Scale Farmers Association Group

texts.en:
Justine N., 35, belongs to Katikko Small Scale Farmers Association-Mityana. The mother of four has been running a retail shop in Katikko for the past decade and she says because of the hard work she has put in, it has been worthwhile. 

Justine says she used profits from her farming business to take root in her general merchandise retail shop. Weekly, she says, this business generates her 20,000 UGX and she says with this loan she is going to purchase more retail commodities to resell at her shop.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities to resell at her shop

loans.name: Tawadzana Group

texts.en:
Ellen M. is the leader of Tawadzana Group. She is 63 years old and married with 6 children, all of whom are now married. She takes care of a grandchild, age 15, and her late sister's child, also age 15. She has been running a tailoring business since 1997 and makes chair backs and seat covers. These products are sold to the local market in Zimbabwe and also to ladies who resell mainly in South Africa. In addition, she owns a grinding mill in Banket (Zimbabwe) where she grinds maize for mealie meal used to cook the country’s staple food. Her other income comes from a room she is letting at her house. The challenges to her business are low capital base and business fluctuations with very low sales in some months. 

Ellen requested this loan through MicroKing for the purpose of purchasing materials to make seat covers and chair backs.  She says the extra income would significantly help her reduce the burden on her children as she normally asks for capital injection from them. In future she would like to generate more income in order to buy a cash-generating asset as the current job is now heavy for her.

loans.use: to purchase sewing material for seat covers and chair backs

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia M. is a married woman with one child who is working. They live at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are electricity bills and clothing. For over fifteen years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She sells cooked beans, rice and chapati (flat bread). 

She faces a major challenge of competition from other food stall operators in her area. Patricia dreams of expanding her business and establishing a retail shop in the future. With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of rice, sugar, baking flour and cooking flour. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice, sugar, baking flour and cooking flour

loans.name: Elvis Antonio

texts.es:
Elvis Antonio T. quien se dedicó gran parte de su vida a ser obrero en construcciones, un día se levantó con la motivación de ser independiente, fue entonces cuando decidió comprar con lo poco que tenía un cajón para vender dulces y un poco de surtido para iniciar con esta idea, poco a poco fue vendiendo más y más y es así como cubre los gastos del hogar. 

Elvis necesita de un préstamo para comprar un paraguas más grande que le permita cubrirse cuando llueve, otros cajones para acomodar más surtido y una nevera de icopor.
texts.en:
Elvis Antonio T. has spent a big part of his life working in construction, and one day he woke up with the desire to be independent, and it was then that he decided to buy, with the little that he had, a case for selling sweets and a small range to get started with this idea. Little by little he sold more and more and this is how he covers his living expenses. 

Elvis needs a loan to buy a bigger umbrella that can cover him when it rains, other cases to hold a bigger range and a styrofoam icebox.

loans.use: To buy an umbrella, cases for holding his range and a styrofoam icebox

loans.name: Consili

texts.en:
Consili was born in 1975. She has four children who are between the ages of 4 and 17 years old. All her children are in school and they are all doing well.

She owns a store in which she sells sugar, maize flour and rice. She is requesting a loan to buy sugar, maize flour and rice in order to make more profits.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize, flour and rice

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 26-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife. He has owned a poultry shop since 2009 and has worked in this field for six years. He has good number of customers passing by his shop buying tasty grilled chicken.  He works hard to earn a good income and be able to cover their weighty living expenses. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new refrigerator in order to better preserve the meat. He is planning to have a baby very soon so he is willing to double his work efforts to gain higher income and be capable of handling the upcoming expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a new refrigerator to preserve meat.

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu A. is a married woman with six children, three of whom graduated from school while three still attend school. They own a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are electricity bills, school fees and clothing. 

For over ten years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling from home to her neighbors. Mwanamkuu has been able to meet her family's basic needs from her income and she wants to start another business, a retail shop, selling household goods to her neighbors.

With the KES 25,000 she is requesting, she wants to open a retail shop business, purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to open a retail shop business, purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar

loans.name: Youth Development Association Group

texts.en:
Kimeze W., 28, is a hard working businessman who has been operating his butcher shop for three years now in Kasanda-Mityana. 

Kimeze was still farming at the threshold of 2008. Earnings from his farming business enabled him to establish himself in this butcher business. He dispensed with the farming business the moment he realized that he could make more profit from his butcher shop.

Weekly this business generates him 150,000 UGX as profit. With this loan, Kimeze, who is still single, says he is going to open new horizons for his business in terms of expansion and the purchase of more meat to resell.

loans.use: to expand his butcher shop and purchase more meat to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new tools, extra seeds, and herbs.

loans.name: Egide

texts.en:
Egide was born in 1988. He is a single, hardworking man.

He owns a store in which he sells sugar, maize flour, rice and other items. He has done this business for one year.

He is requesting a loan to buy more sugar, salt and rice to increase his inventory. With the profits, he plans to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt and rice

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella S. is married and has five children, four of whom still attend school while one has graduated from school. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and clothing. 

For the past 21 years, she has operated a fish-selling business and she also sells maandazi (dumplings) from home to her neighbors and passersby. 

Stella faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing another business in the market. 

Stella decided to access loans to improve her living standards. With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase a Kenyan ceramic jiko (an efficient charcoal stove) and renovate her selling stall.

loans.use: to purchase a Kenyan ceramic jiko and renovate her selling stall

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.es:
Jennifer nació en la ciudad de Lima y tiene 22 años de edad. Actualmente, Jennifer vive en la ciudad imperial de los Incas (Cusco, Perú), ella es una madre responsable que saca adelante a su familia y su actividad económica principal es la venta de productos de belleza. Ya es un año y medio que trabaja en este negocio y va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Jennifer en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos de belleza. 

Jennifer es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Ana Jarvis III” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Jennifer was born in the city of Lima and is 22 years old. Currently, Jennifer lives in the imperial city of the Incas (Cusco, Perú). She is a responsible mother who is working to get her family ahead. Her main business activity is selling beauty products. She has been in this line of work for a year and a half and it is going very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. Jennifer at this time requires a loan to purchase more beauty products. 

Jennifer is a responsible person who belongs to the “Ana Jarvis III” communal bank of the "Asociación Arariwa" in the city of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Adono

texts.fr:
Madame Adono exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente des condiments. En effet elle s’approvisionne en petit poisson au port de pèche et Baguida qu’elle revient fris dans l’huile pour la vente, et au grand marché de Lomé  pour divers autres condiments. Elle revend ensuite à la devanture de sa maison dans un hagar.. Elle est très accueillante et attire de plus en plus de clients.   Elle espère accroître sa marge bénéficiaire et demande un prêt pour acheter  5 tas de  petits poissons, 4 paniers de tomate, 3 paniers de gombo et 2 paniers de piment vert.
Elle a 42 ans et est mariée à un transitaire de profession. Elle est résidente à Baguida et a 3 enfants en charge.
texts.en:
Ms. Adono has a revenue-generating business selling condiments. Basically, she stocks up on small fish at the fishing port and she brings them back fried in oil for resale in Baguida. She also stocks up at the main market of Lomé for a variety of condiments. She then makes her sales in a shed in front of her house. She is very accommodating and attracts more and more customers. 

She hopes to increase her profit margin and is asking for a loan for buying: 5 piles of small fish, 4 baskets of tomatoes, 3 baskets of okra, and 2 baskets of green chili peppers. 

She is 42 years old and married to a shipping agent. She is a resident of Baguida and has three children to support.

loans.use: achat de petit poissons, tomate, gombo et  piment vert

loans.name: Toribio Marcial

texts.es: Toribio se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras. Es una persona muy luchadora y se destaca por proporcionar un buen servicio a sus clientes. Inicio este medio de vida por la necesidad de sufragar los gastos,  tiene 1 hijo de 6 años de edad a su cargo. Todos los días se levanta temprano para empezar su actividad y ofrecerles a sus clientes las mejores frutas y verduras. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de bananos, naranjas, melones, sandias, mangos entre otras frutas. Sueña con poder brindarle a su hijo una mejor educación y así pueda obtener un futuro.
texts.en: Toribio sells fruits and vegetables. He is a very hardworking person and stands out by giving his customers very good service. He began working in this field by the need to meet his expenses; he has a 6 year old son that is under his care. Everyday Toribio wakes up early to begin working and to offer his customers the best fruits and vegetables. The loan is to buy bananas, oranges, melons, watermelons, mangos and other fruits. He dreams being able to give his son a better education so that he can have a future.

loans.use: buy bananas, oranges, melons, watermelons, mangos among other fruits.

loans.name: Ayudemonos Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento ayudémonos esta en su segundo ciclo del zona del plan tres mil, esta integrado por siete mujeres y un hombre las señora Mary  es la presidenta y su actividad principal es un salón de belleza que ella atiende, esta casada y tiene tres hijos menores que están estudiando su marido es albañil toda su familia es muy unida, ella trabaja mucho para ofrecerles a sus hijos un futuro mejor, con el dinero del crédito comprara tintes para cabello, champo, lavadores, y todo lo que necesita para utilizar en su salón de belleza,  la señora mercedes es la tesorera del banco de emprendimiento su actividad principal es la venta de ropa americana no tiene puesto fijo va de feria en feria vendiendo su producto tiene su esposo que trabaja de maestro albañil dos niñas menores de edad que están estudiando en primaria con el crédito que ofrecemos aumenta su capital para la compra de ropa americana, todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que están agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The “Ayudémonos” (Let Us Help Ourselves) communal bank is in its second cycle in the Plan 3000 zone.  Its members are seven women and one man.  Mary is group President.

Her main activity is operating a Beauty Salon.  She’s married and has three minor children who are in school.  Her husband is a Bricklayer.  All of the family is very united.  She works a lot to offer a better future to her children.  She will use the loan money to buy beauty supplies like hair coloring, shampoo, washers and everything she needs to use in her beauty salon.

Mercedes is Treasurer.  Her main activity is selling American clothes.  She does not have a fixed stand but rather goes from market to market selling her wares.  Her husband is a Master Bricklayer and they have two minor daughters who are in elementary school. She will use the loan we offered to increase capital buying American clothes.

All the members are responsible, hard working people who are grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter M. N. is a 36-year-old businessman. He sells timber to earn a living. He has been in the business for six years. So far, he has employed three people in his business.   

He also earns extra income from his rental houses. 

Peter is a married man with two children in school. Hence, he works hard to educate them. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to improve his family's standard of living.  He hopes to open a timber processing factory in the future.  

With the loan of 80,000 KES, he will buy timber.

loans.use: to buy timber

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana de 39 años, una mujer trabajadora que inicio su actividad hace 8 años con una nevera pequeña vendiendo hielo para sus clientes que tiene negocio en sus hogares.

Ella vende diariamente o cuando sus clientes lo necesitan, es viuda y tiene una hija de 16 años que todavía estudia. Con el préstamo ella desea comprar lana, hilo, productos Yanbal para aumentar sus ingresos. Ella en un futuro quiere abrir una papelería y  poder ayudar a su hija en sus próximos estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Juana is 39 years old; she is a hardworking woman that began working 8 years ago with a small refrigerator selling ice to her customers who have businesses in their homes.

Juana sells her items everyday or when her customers need her. She is a widow and has a 16 year old daughter that is still attending school. With the loan she will buy yarn, thread and Yanbal products to increase her income. In the future Juana hopes to have a stationary store and to help her daughter with her upcoming university education.

loans.use: buy yarn, threads and yanbal products.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge de 45 años, es un hombre trabajador que empezó su actividad hace 16 años como empleado de maestro de cerrajería pero un día decidió abrir su propio negocio y así ayudar a su familia.

Ella labora dependiendo los pedidos de sus clientes con ayuda de sus hijos. La dificultad de su trabajo son las enfermedades ya que los materiales con lo que trabaja son dañino y le perjudica su salud. Con el préstamo quiere comprar más materiales para su trabajo. En un futuro el desea terminar de adecuar su vivienda y así poder aumentar su ingresos en el taller.
texts.en:
Jorge, 45, is a hard working man who started his activity 16 years ago as an employee of a Master Metalworker but one day he decided to open his own business and help his family that way.

He works according to orders from his customers and with help from his children.  The difficulty with his work is illnesses because the materials he works with are harmful and damage his health.

He wants to use the loan to buy more work supplies.  In the future he’d like to finish furnishing his house and to increase earnings in his workshop.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his shop.

loans.name: Kamu Kamu Women's Group, Kyenjojo

texts.en: A. George William is the leader of Kamu Kamu Women's Group in Kyenjojo. He is 52 years old and married with six children, four of whom are still in school. George William sells produce including maize, beans, and coffee, and is also a tea farmer from Kitoma. He works with two of his eldest sons selling to grocery stores in Kyarusozi and Fort Portal. He is able to make 120,000 shillings as weekly profits in a business he has owned for 20 years. He accumulated most of his capital from the tea-growing, as well as being trustworthy. George William has a dream of putting up a coffee factory and a maize mill. He needs a loan to be able to buy more produce stock for resale.

loans.use: To buy more produce stock for resale

loans.name: Francisco Ismael

texts.es:
Francisco de 51 años, es un hombre que empezó desde pequeño con su padre en la actividad de ebanistería (arreglo de materiales de madera) y siguió con el negocio.

En la actualidad trabaja diariamente con ayuda de sus hijos. Está casado y  ella vende mercadería a diferentes personas. En el negocio le afecta mucho la competencia ya que hay muchos lugares con la misma actividad. Con el préstamo quiere comprar materiales de madera para así mejorar sus ingresos económicos. En un futuro lo que más quiere es poder terminar su vivienda para así tener una vida plena con su conyugue.
texts.en:
Francisco is 51 years old, he began working from a very young age with his father in a carpentry workshop and he continued with the business.

At present he works everyday with his children’s help. Francisco is married and his wife sells items to different people. The business is hurt a bit by competition since there are many places that do the same work. With the loan he will buy lumber materials to improve his earnings. In the future he wants to finish building his home and to have a fulfilling life with his partner.

loans.use: buy boards, glue and other items.

loans.name: Norma Leonor

texts.es:
Norma de 56 años, es una mujer trabajadora un día que fue a Guayaquil recaudo un dinero y lo invirtió en  una pequeña tienda.

En la actualidad trabaja diariamente y sola en algunas ocasiones cuando se enferma la viene ayudar su hermana. Con el préstamo va a comprar producto para su tienda como arroz, aceite, azúcar para así incrementar sus ingresos. En un futuro desea terminar de adecuar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Norma is 56 years old, and is a hardworking woman. One day she went to Guayaquil and collected some money and invested it in a small grocery store.

At present, she works each day alone and when she gets sick her sister comes to help.

With the loan, Norma will buy merchandize for her store like rice, oil, and sugar to increase her earnings. In the future she hopes to finish reworking her home.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Alexi Maria

texts.es:
Alexi de 34 años, es una mujer trabajadora que inicio su actividad cuando ella estaba embarazada y su esposo le compro una carreta.

Ella trabaja sola de miércoles a domingo por la tarde hasta la noche vendiendo comidas rápidas. Una de sus dificultades en su negocio es la competencia ya que hay muchos puesto sobre lo mismo por el sector. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar más su mercadería para la carreta como ollas, baldes, aceite, carnes para así expandir su negocio e incrementar sus ganancias para darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Alexi is 34 years old, she is a hardworking woman that began working when she was pregnant and her husband bought her a cart.
She works alone Wednesday through Sunday from the afternoon until nightfall selling fast-food. One of the problems of her business is the competition since there are many other sellers in the same area. With the loan she wants to buy more merchandize for the cart and expand her business and increase her earnings to give her family the best.

loans.use: to purchase pans, buckets, oil, and meat

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando 61 años, un hombre trabajador que empezó su actividad hace 13 años en Guayaquil luego se compro una casa en duran que después traslado su negocio donde ahora está viviendo.

En la actualidad trabaja con la ayuda de su esposa todos los días de 7:00am a 7:00 pm. Si dificultad en el negocio es la delincuencia ya que por el sector se ha vuelto muy peligroso. Tiene hijos independientes. Con el préstamo quiere comprar más mercadería para su negocio e incrementar sus ganancia tales como bebidas, confites, granos. En un futuro quiere comprarse una camioneta para poder transportar su mercadería cuando van a comprar a las distribuidoras de vegetales.
texts.en:
Fernando is 61 years old, and is a hardworking man. He began working 13 years ago in Guayaquil and later bought a home in Duran and later moved his business where he is now living.
At present, he works with his wife’s help everyday from 7:00 a.m. to 7 p.m. He does have some problems with delinquents since the area has become very dangerous. Fernando has self-sufficient children. With the loan he wants to buy more merchandize for his business and to increase his earnings with beverages, candies, and grains. In the future, Fernando would like to buy a truck to be able to transport his merchandize when they go buy their products at vegetable distributors.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, candies, and grains

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 36-year-old married man with three children in school. He has been selling fish for the past 13 years. He has employed two people to assist him in his business. He decided to leave employment so as to concentrate on his business. He has previously received a loan from Faulu Kenya. He has requested another loan of 50,000 KES, which he will use to buy more fish and a freezer.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and more fish

loans.name: Maria Alejandra

texts.es: La Señora Maria Alejandra tiene 33 años, como es madre soltera vive con su hijo de seis meses que necesita mucho cuido. Tiene más de 5 años en su negocio, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Inicio este medio de vida porque no tenía un trabajo estable que le generara ingresos para su hogar, ella sale todos los días con su bolso en donde ofrece calzado, bolsos, ropa en general, tratamientos, perfumes entre otros. Ella trabaja todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche la mayoría de sus clientes demostraron ser clientes muy responsables y puntuales con los pagos. Con el dinero del crédito comprara perfumes, cremas, toallas, sabanas, calzado, cosméticos, tratamientos y ropa en general.
texts.en: Mrs. Maria Alejandra is 33 years old, and a single mother who lives with her six-month old son that needs a lot of care. She has had her business for over 5 years where she sells general merchandize. She began working in this field because she didn’t have a steady job that gave her enough earnings for her home. Each day, Maria, goes out with her purse and sells shoes, purses, all types of clothing, treatments, perfumes and other items. She works everyday from 7 in the morning until 9 at night, the majority of her customers have been very responsible and punctual with their payments. With the loan she will buy perfumes, creams, towels, sheets, shoes, makeup, treatments and a variety of clothing.

loans.use: buy perfumes, creams, towels, sheets, shoes, makeup, treatments and a variety of clothing.

loans.name: Margarita Katty

texts.es:
Margarita de 37 años, es una mujer trabajadora  que inicio con la venta de cosméticos para apoyar a su familia está casada  y de su relación tiene dos hijos . Su conyugue trabaja como maestro albañil.

Ella trabaja en la tarde haciendo lo pedidos de sus clientes y a la vez va hacer sus cobranzas ya que lo deja créditos. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, bloques. Su anhelo más deseado es termina de adecuar su casa para así tener una vida plena con su familia y nada le falten a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Margarita is 37 years old; she is a hardworking woman that began selling makeup to support her family. She is married and from that relationship she has two children. Her husband works as a mason.
Margarita works in the afternoons getting her customers’ orders and collects their debt. With the loan she wants to buy more construction materials such as cement, sand, and blocks. Her biggest dream is to finish fixing her home so that she can have a fulfilling life with her family and that her children will not lack for anything.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, and blocks

loans.name: Glenda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Glenda de 28 años, es una mujer trabajadora que desea apoyar a su familia en lo económico se inicio en la actividad de ventas de encebollados gracias a la ayuda de su padre que le enseño.

Ahora ella se dedica a la venta de encebollados. Su dificultad del trabajo es la delincuencia ya que la zona es muy peligrosa. Está casada y del fruto de su relación tienen 3 hijos menores de edad que aun no estudian, su esposo prestan su servicios como maestro albañil. Con el apoyo del préstamo quiere adecuar su vivienda. En un futuro lo que más desea es abrir otro local para así aumentar sus ingresos y  darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Glenda is 28 years old; she is a hardworking woman that wishes to help her family financially. She began selling encebollados (a dish made from fish, onions and cassava) thanks to her father who taught her.

Glenda sells encebollados. A problem that she faces is delinquency since the area that she works in is very dangerous. She is married and out of the relationship she has 3 underage children that are not of school age, her husband is a master mason. With the loan, Glenda wants to fix her home. In the future she dreams of opening another stall to increase her income and to provide her children the best.

loans.use: buy materials to fix her stall.

loans.name: Zoila Rita

texts.es:
Zoila de 54 años, es una mujer trabajadora que comenzó su actividad haciendo confecciones de ropa a sus clientes para así tener sus ganancias.

Ahora ella trabaja sola confeccionando ropa y cortinas o los que sus clientes le pidan. Lo que le afectad en su trabajo es la delincuencia que existe por su sector. Es soltera tiene tres hijos que son profesionales. Con el préstamo quiere adecuar su vivienda para así tener una vida tranquila y seguir en su negocio de confecciones.
texts.en:
Zoila is 54 years old; she is a hardworking woman that began working making clothing for her customers in order to get income.

Zoila works alone making clothing and curtains or whatever her customers want. A problem that she faces in her work is the delinquency that exists in her area. She is single and has 3 children that are professionals. With the loan she wants to fix her home so that she can have a calm life and to keep working as a seamstress.

loans.use: fix her home.

loans.name: Tunka Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento TUNKA es un grupo formado en la zona de Villa Concepción, se encuentra en su octavo ciclo de trabajo sin haber tenido problemas de pago alguno , son ocho socias muy responsables que se dedican a distintas actividades con lo que mantienen a sus familias como la señora Placida que es la presidenta de grupo y se dedica la costura de enaguas y polleras, ella no vive con su esposo por lo que se ocupa sola de sus hijos con los gastos del hogar, usara el préstamo solicitado para la compra de una maquina de costura y así incrementar su producción ya que tiene muchos pedidos que debe cumplir. al igual que la señora placida las demás socias usaran el préstamo para el incremento de su capital de trabajo, y en algunos casos para el inicio de un negocio. enla foto una de lassocias vino acompañada de su esposo.
texts.en:
The TUNKA entrepreneur bank is a group that was established in the Villa Concepción area and has entered its eighth work cycle without any payment problems whatsoever.  It is comprised of eight very responsible members who carry out different business activities to maintain their families.  

Mrs. Placida is the president of the group and is a seamstress who makes undergarments.  She does not live with her husband so is responsible for her children and for covering household expenses.  She plans to use the loan to buy a sewing machine so she can increase production since she has many orders to fill.  The other members plan to use the loan to either increase their working capital or begin a business.  As seen in the photo, one of the members came with her husband.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Kamu Kamu Women's Group A In Kyenjojo

texts.en: A. Clovis is the leader of Kamu Kamu Women's Group A in Kyenjojo. He is also the treasurer of his group and a strong force in ensuring that all the other members pay back their loans promptly. He is married with school-going children. Clovis sells goods like maize, beans, and coffee, and is also a tea farmer from Kitoma. In fact, he has a very big tea plantation, so much so that trucks come to his home to load, meaning he does not waste money looking for a market, since he is strategically positioned, hardworking, and friendly. He is able to make 320,000 shillings as weekly profit in his tea-growing business. He accumulated most of his capital from tea-growing, enabling him to start up the grocery-selling business. He needs a loan to be able to stock more goods for resale.

loans.use: to stock more goods for resale, like maize, beans, and coffee

loans.name: Antolin Lodimiro

texts.es:
Antolín de 53 años, es un hombre inspirador que trabaja en una empresa de alimentos como ayudante de bodega.

El trabaja diariamente ayudando en cargas de alimentos para ser enviados a diferentes lugares. Esta cada  tienen 2 hijos que son profesionales. Con el préstamo quiere adecuar su casa para así abrir su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Antolín is 53 years old and is an ambitious man who works as a warehouse assistant in a food company.

His job consists of helping to load food shipments to be sent to different places.  He is married and has two children with professional careers.  He plans to use the loan to renovate his house so he can open his own business.

loans.use: To renovate his house

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor de 40 años, es una mujer inspiradora en ganar dinero para así apoyar a su familia en los gastos del hogar. Está casada y tiene un hijo.

Ella trabaja diariamente en su tienda vendiendo productos a sus clientes. Su esposo trabaja haciendo cargas en su camioneta. Con el préstamo va a comprar víveres y abarrotes para su negocio para incrementar sus ganancias. En un futuro desea que su esposo se compre una camioneta nueva y que su negocio sea más grande para que sea más surtidor en sus ventas.
texts.en:
Flor is 40 years old and very ambitious in her desire to earn money to support her family and cover household expenses.  She is married and has a son.

She runs a store where she works daily attending to customers.  Her husband is a delivery truck driver.  She plans to use the loan to buy more groceries for her business in order to increase income.  In the future she would like her husband to buy a new truck; and she also wants to expand her business to be able to offer more variety.

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Alis Maria

texts.es:
Alis María D. M., tiene la edad de 24 años de edad, está en unión libre  y vive con sus 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad y su esposo. Ella pretende comprar con el dinero los insumos y los fertilizantes para su cafetal. Ella cuenta con la experiencia y la plantación ya establecida por lo cual ella  quiere es mejorarla y así obtener mejores cosechas este año. Ella pretende con estos llegar a cumplir varias metas que tiene y así también tener una estabilidad familiar para un mejor bienestar. También ella piensa en el futuro de sus hijos y es por eso que quiere tener un mayor  ingreso para ofrecerles facilidades y el estudio en un futuro.
Es el primer  préstamo que a recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Alis María D. M. is 24 year old and has a common-law husband and two children who are her top priority.  She wants to buy supplies and fertilizer for her coffee plantation.  She has the experience and the established plantation so it is a matter of improving it to harvest a better crop this year.

She has several goals in mind and also wants to increase household stability for a better lifestyle.  Her children's future is also foremost in her mind and for this reason she wants to increase her income, making it easier for them to get an education.

This is her first loan through FUDECOSUR.  She has never had any loans through state banks; but FUDECOSUR is giving her better payment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy coffee crop supplies

loans.name: Jeaney

texts.es:
Jeaney  Pérez G., tiene la edad de 20 años de edad, está soltero y vive con su madre. El pretende comprar con el dinero  las bolsas para sembrar el café y los insumos para la asistencia de este. El lo que pretende es tener el almacigo para la venta y así obtener ganancias para su bienestar y la de su madre. El cuenta con la experiencia en la elaboración de almácigos por lo cual quiere  invertir en esto pues es una opción de mucha venta  e ingresos. El quiere generar ganancias para su madre y el y a la vesz tener un nivel económico mejor.  
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Jeaney Pérez G. is 20 years old, single and lives with his mother.  He wants to use the loan to buy bags of coffee seeds and supplies to care for the crop.  He wants to sell seed-beds in order to obtain enough profit to improve his and his mother's lifestyle.

He has experience working with seed-beds and wants to invest in the business because he knows sales and income are a good option.  This is a way of generating more income for his mother and himself and for them to have a better economic level.

This is his first loan through FUDECOSUR.  He has never taken out any state bank loans; but FUDECOSUR is giving him a loan with better payment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy and plant seed-beds

loans.name: Virginia Patricia

texts.es: Virginia tiene 51 años, su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de costura. Este no es el primer financiamiento que ella ha realizado con Fundación León 2000, pues estos han sido de gran apoyo. Pues ella es una persona muy ejemplar que disfruta su negocio y además que siempre ha trabajado, ella tiene muchos clientes por lo que tiene una diversidad de encargos, por lo que está muy acostumbrada a realizar este tipo de trabajos. Es por este motivo que ella solicita este financiamiento que es destinado para capital de trabajo como agujas, tijeras, hilos, tela, zipper y botones. Su deseo es mantener activo su negocio que es su único medio de vida.
texts.en:
Virginia is 51 years old.  Her work is offering sewing services. 

This is not her first loan from Fundacion Leon 2000 and the previous ones have been of great help. She is an exemplary person who enjoys her work. She has many customers because she offers diversity and is used to doing this kind of work.

She is requesting the loan as working capital to buy needles, scissors, threads, fabrics, zippers and buttons. Her wish is to maintain an active business which is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy needles, scissors, threads, fabrics, zippers and buttons

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Benito S., le está haciendo falta reparación del techo que cuando llueve tiene filtraciones y la humedad le esta dañando la salud a su familia. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder compra el material y pagarle a la persona que realizara las reparaciones a su vivienda. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo, como administrador de compañía de trasportes. 
 Desea que su familia tenga una mejor casa y que estén seguros.
texts.en:
Mr. Benito Sanchez’s house needs repairs because the roof has filtrations when it rains and the dampness is affecting his family’s health.

He is requesting the loan to buy materials and to pay someone to make the repairs in his house.

He plans to repay the loan from the income he receives as an administrator at a transport company. He wishes to provide a better home and security to his family.

loans.use: to repair the roof of the house.

loans.name: Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
Flor D. Maria, 38 años D. edad, casada, con 3 hijos.
Flor D. Marìa tiene un negocio D. manualidades / Chocolaterìa; a elL. desD. siempre le ha gustado hacer manualidades y a preparar chocolates y lo hace muy bièn; asì que se animò a abrir un local para atender tantos pedidos.
Flor D. Marìa tiene 3 hijos menores que estudian en un colegio estatal; su esposo es profesor y trabaja para su localidad en el disrito D. Jauja.
El prèstamo que se le ha otorgado es para L. compra D. mejores insumos para confecciòn D. los chocolates.
En L. fotografìa Flor D. Marìa es L. D. L. foto pequeña D. L. parte superior D. L. derecha y esta vestida con camisa color beige (elL. saliò en L. foto granD. detràs D. otra socia)
L. foto pequeña D. L. parte inferior derecha pertenece al socio: Wilfredo C., y no se encontraba presente en L. reunion por estar trabajando.
L. foto pequeña D. L. parte superior izquierda pertenece a Mònica G., no pudo asistir por encontrarse estudiando.
L. foto pequeña D. L. parte inferior izquierda pertenece a Alvina V., elL. en L. fotografìa granD. esta con L. cabeza baja.
El socio Alcides A. no se encuentra en L. fotografìa porque estaba realizando trabajos en L. carretera.
texts.en:
Flor D. Maria is 38 years old.  She is married and has three children.  She has a handicrafts / chocolate business.  Flor D. Maria has always enjoyed making handicrafts and chocolates and she does it very well.  For this reason, she decided to open premises in order to attend to all her orders.  Flor D. Maria has 3 children who are attending high school.  Her husband is a teacher and works in their town, in Jauja district.  Flor D. Maria will use the loan that she has been granted to buy better supplies for making her chocolates.

In the picture, Flor D. Maria is the woman in the small photo on the top right who is wearing a beige-colored shirt (she appears in the larger photo behind another member).
The small photo on the bottom right belongs to Wilfredo C. who wasn't present at the meeting because he was working.
The small photo on the top left belongs to Mónica G. who couldn't attend the meeting because she was studying.
The small photo on the bottom left belongs to Alvina V. who appears in the main photo but her head is lowered.
Alcides A. is not in the photograph because he was doing work on the road.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making chocolate

loans.name: Rosa Luz

texts.es:
Rosa Luz  es una confeccionista de ropa femenina  e infantil que vive y tiene su negocio  en la Ciudadela 20 de Julio, un barrio donde interactúa lo comercial, residencial donde también están ubicados escenarios deportivos y recreativos,  entre los cuales se destaca el Estadio metropolitano de la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde los equipos profesionales de Colombia practican el futbol, que es  deporte que concentra a todo el país  pero especialmente a quienes viven el la cálida ciudad de Barranquilla y la costa norte de Colombia.
Rosa Luz inició su negocio de confecciones en el año 2001, aunque su experiencia en este arte data desde 1977, época desde la cual ha  ido perfeccionando sus técnicas con el transcurrir del tiempo,  desarrollando una buena calidad en las prendas que elabora y por eso sus clientes la prefieren  y esto hace importante el trabajo que Rosa desarrolla   porque su mayor desafío es la competencia, la cual  incursiona con precios y productos de poca durabilidad. Este es su primer financiamiento y requiere comprar telas, hilos, encajes y botones en mayor volumen, para obtener descuentos especiales. Sus activos fijos asociados al negocio son una máquina de coser, una fileteadora y herramientas varias, ubicadas en el segundo piso de su vivienda. Los principales clientes de Rosa son personas tradicionalmente atendidas por ella, vecinas, familiares, referidos a los cuales responde sobre pedidos en la modalidad de contado y a crédito. 
Rosa Luz trabaja con una de sus cinco hijos en la microempresas y tiene como meta mas adelante adquirir una máquina de coser industrial para  aumentar los tiempos productivos y  la calidad del negocio, con ello logrará mejorar los ingresos y la  productividad y por consiguiente la calidad de vida familiar y es que este es aun su gran reto.
texts.en:
Rosa Luz is a dressmaker who makes women's and children's clothes.  She lives and has her business in Ciudadela 20 de Julio which is a neighborhood where commercial and residential areas mix.  It is also the home to sporting and recreational grounds, the most important of which is the city of Barranquilla's Estadio Metropolitano where Colombia's professional teams play soccer.  Soccer is a sport that unites the whole country but especially the people who live in the warm city of Barranquilla and on the north coast of Colombia.

Rosa Luz started her dressmaking business in 2001 although her experience in this art dates back to 1977.  Over time, she has perfected her techniques.  She makes good-quality clothes and, for this reason, she has loyal customers which is important because Rosa's greatest challenge in her business is the competition who make inroads into the trade with short-lasting prices and products.

This is Rosa's first loan and she needs it to buy fabrics, thread, lace and buttons in large quantities so that she can obtain special discounts.  Rosa's fixed business assets are a sewing machine, an overlock sewing machine and various tools which are all located on the second floor of her home.  Rosa's main customers are people who have traditionally been served by her: neighbors and family members.  She offers her products for cash or on credit.

Rosa Luz works with one of her five children in her small business and her goal for the future is to acquire an industrial sewing machine so that she can improve her production times and the quality of her business.  This will enable her to improve her income and productivity and, as a result, her family's quality of life.  This is still her big challenge.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, lace and buttons

loans.name: Jaockim

texts.en: Jaockim is 33 years old, married, and the father of four. His spouse is a businesswoman, and they have a family of six people, with no other dependents.  He lives in his own house, and his family goal is to educate his children. His home address is Kiryatete West, Hoima. He has a retail shop and has owned it for two years. He faces a challenge of demand fluctuation and hopes in the future to have a big wholesale shop. He requests a loan to help him purchase general merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase general merchandise

loans.name: Blanca Rita

texts.es: Blanca Rita tiene 57 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Inicio este medio de vida porque no tenía los ingresos necesarios para sufragar los gastos de su hogar. Ella trabaja todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, por lo que la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a buscar los productos que ofrece de primera necesidad. Es una persona muy responsable y esta no ha sido la primera vez que ha solicitado financiamientos por lo que se siente muy contenta. Este crédito es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes, granos básicos, jugos, sopas, avena y productos enlatados.
texts.en: Blanca Rita is 57 years old. Her activity is a grocery store. She started this way of life because she didn't have enough income to pay for her household expenses. She works every day from 6 in the morning until 9 at night. Most of her customers come looking for basic neccesity products. She is a responsible and this is not the first time that she has asked for loans, which makes her very happy. This loan is to buy candies, beverages, bread, detergent, basic grains, juices, soups, oatmeal and canned products.

loans.use: to buy candy, beverages, bread, detergent, basic grains, juices, soup, oatmeal, and canned products.

loans.name: Villa Santa Rosa Group

texts.es: Yolanda es integrante y tiene el cargo D. tesorera en la nueva Alcancía Comunal “Villa Santa Rosa” en donD. participan 10 mujeres trabajadoras que se dedican al comercio, Yolanda viene trabajando hace 9 años en su propia bodega bazar en la zona D. caja marquilla, nos cuenta que antes solo se dedicaba a la crianza D. cerdos  pero con la ayuda D. su única hija pudo avanzar y ahora tener un negocio propio  en casa. Yolanda es madre soltera  y a sus 52 años anhela  darle educación superior a su hija y apoyar  en la educación D. sus nietos además desea construir el segundo piso D. su vivienda para poder dar en alquiler  como departamento pues  tiene disponible esta parte D. su casa.  El crédito solicitado será invertido en la bodega con productos leche, azúcar, arroz, y papeles, Yolanda le puso a su negocio el nombre D. sus nietos  “Valeria  y Brando”. Nuestras socias del a Alcom” Villa santa Rosa” están entusiastas y comprometidas a generar utilidades para sus familias y honradas D. participar en el programa Prosperidad D. EDAPROSPO. Podemos verlas en el comedor comunal D. su comunidad en donD. no hay luz eléctrica realizando una ceremonia D. inauguración D. su  Alcancía comunal luego del desembolso, es algo clásico el compartir como parte D. la ceremonia y en compañía D. sus hijos.
texts.en: Yolanda is a member and the treasurer of the new community savings bank called “Villa Santa Rosa”, which has 10 hardworking women who work as merchants.
